data.title: How Do I Add FieldFlō To My Home Screen? (Spanish)
data.description: Este artículo te guiará a través de los pasos sobre cómo agregar FieldFlō a la pantalla de inicio de tu dispositivo. Este artículo cubrirá dispositivos Android, iPhones/iPads y computadoras.
data.body:
Agregar FieldFlō a tu pantalla de inicio ahorra tiempo. Esto te permite hacer clic en un ícono en tu pantalla de inicio para acceder a FieldFlō, en lugar de escribir el URL de tu empresa en un navegador cada vez que inicias sesión. ¡Este artículo te guiará a través de los pasos exactos para lograrlo! 

# Aquí están los pasos para agregar FieldFlō a la pantalla de inicio de un dispositivo Android:

- Abra su plataforma de FieldFlo en Chrome para Android e inicie sesión. 
- Toca el botón de menú junto a la barra de direcciones. ---> 
- Luego seleccionaráAgregar a la pantalla de inicio. 
- El icono de FieldFlo aparecerá en su pantalla de inicio como cualquier otra aplicación. Siéntase libre de moverlo. Cuando la seleccione, FieldFlo se abrirá en pantalla completa.# Aquí están los pasos para agregar FieldFlō a la pantalla de inicio de un iPhone/iPad:1. Abra su plataforma de FieldFlo en Safari e inicie sesión.2. Toque el botón de compartir en la parte inferior de la pantalla --->3. Luego seleccionaráAgregar a la pantalla de inicio.4. El icono de FieldFlo aparecerá en su pantalla de inicio como cualquier otra aplicación. Siéntase libre de moverlo. Cuando la seleccione, FieldFlo se abrirá en pantalla completa.# Aquí están los pasos para agregar FieldFlō a la pantalla de inicio de una computadora:1. Abre FieldFlō en el navegador web Google Chrome e inicia sesión.2. Resalta la URL de FieldFlō en la barra de búsqueda y luego arrástrala y suéltala directamente en tu pantalla principal.3. Una vez que FieldFlō esté en tu pantalla principal, puedes cambiar el nombre de este acceso directo haciendo clic derecho sobre el ícono y seleccionandoRenombrar.

data.title: How Do I Add FieldFlō To My Home Screen? (English)
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps o how to add FieldFlō to your device's home screen. This article will cover Android devices, iPhones/iPads, and computers.
data.body:
Adding FieldFlō to your home screen is a time saver. This allows you to click an icon on your home screen to access FieldFlō, instead of typing in your company's URL into a browser each time you log in. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to accomplish this! 

# Here are the steps on how to add FieldFlō to an Android's home screen:

- Open your FieldFlo platform in Chrome for Android, and log in. 
- Tap the menu button next to the address bar ---> 
- ClickAdd to Home screen. 
- The FieldFlo icon will appear on your home screen just like any other app. Feel free to move it around. When you tap it, FieldFlo will open in full screen.# Here are the steps on how to add FieldFlō to an iPhone/iPad's home screen:1. Open your FieldFlo platform in Safari, and log in.2. Tap the share button at the bottom of the screen --->3. SelectAdd to Home Screen.4. The FieldFlo icon will appear on your home screen just like any other app. Feel free to move it around. When you tap it, FieldFlo will open in full screen. 

# Here are the steps on how to add FieldFlō to a computer's home screen:

 1. Open up FieldFlo on Google Chrome web browser and log in. 

 2. Highlight FieldFlo's URL on your search bar, then drag and drop the URL directly to your desktop. 

 3. Once FieldFlo is on your desktop, you can rename this shortcut by right clicking the icon and click Rename.

data.title: How Do I Use The Project Details Read Only Data Object While Building Proposals?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Projects Details Read Only data object while building proposals in FieldFlō's CRM module.
data.body:
The Projects Details Read Only data object is a great way to display basic project information on your proposal. This article will show you the exact steps on how to use this! 

# Required
 In order to build proposals, you must have the following roles enabled: 

 • View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads 
 • Can Add Leads 

# Here are the steps to use the Project Details Read Only data object while building proposals:

- Drag and drop theProjects Details Read Onlydata object to the center of your proposal. 
- Once your Projects Details Read Only data object is dropped, you have the following PROJECT DETAILS DATA SETTINGS to configure and clickSave:•Font Size- Select a font size from the drop-down. This will depict the overall size of the project's details.•Justify- Select the radio button next toLeft,Center, orRightto choose where you want the project details to be displayed.•Color- Select a color from the drop-down. This will be the color of the project details data. 
- Once you clickSave,you have the following options:- Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.- Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Link Assets To An Employee For Scheduling?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to link assets to an employee.
data.body:
Linking assets to an employee will allow you to schedule the employee and asset at the same time easily. This article will show you exactly how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to link assets to an employee, you must have the Add Item inventory permission. 

# Information
 Multiple assets can be linked to one employee, but only one employee can be linked to an asset 

# Here are the steps on how to link assets to an employee for scheduling:

- On your left main menu, clickInventory. 
- Find your inventory item by scrolling, using the search field, or useFiltersto narrow down the inventory list. Once you've found the item, click on it to open up the details. 
- UnderneathAdd To Employee, choose the employee that you need this item linked to and clickSave. 
- Now when scheduling this employee, you have the option to link the schedule to this asset as well!

Once a type is selected, enter the additional data that appears.•Qty- Enter the quantity of this bid item in the text field.•Unit Cost -Enter the cost of one unit.•Description -Enter a brief description of your bid item.•Mark Up- Enter the Markup price in the text field.

data.title: How Do I Use The Signature Data Object While Building Proposals?

data.body:

# Required
 In order to build Proposals, you must have the following roles enabled: 

 • View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads 
 • Can Add Leads 

# Here are the steps to use the Signature data object while building proposals:

- Drag and drop theSignaturedata object to the center of your proposal. 
- Once it's dropped, the SIGNATURE SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and clickSave:•Title -Enter a title in the text field. This is the title that will appear above the signature lines.•Under Text Title- Enter a description or information in the text field. If an option is selected, it will create a signature line for that data to be entered.

data.title: How Do I Use The Crew View While Scheduling?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Crew view to schedule employees and assets.
data.body:
The Crew scheduling view allows you to view all employees/assets at once while configuring hours for each. This article will walk you through the steps on how to use this view! 

# Required
 In order to use the Scheduling module, you must have the Full Scheduling Access role enabled. 

# Here are the steps to use the Crew view while scheduling:

- Once you navigate to the Weekly Scheduling module, click theCrewtab. 
- Find the employee or asset you need to schedule by scrolling, or you can use theEmployee FiltersorAsset Filterson the right hand side to quickly search and narrow down your list. 
- Once you are ready to schedule, click the white space to the right of the employee/asset to start configuring hours. 
- After selecting employees or assets to schedule, set their hours, break times, and add notes using the guide below:•Start- For each day, select the start time in this field.•End- For each day, select the end time in this field.•Break Time- For each day, select their break duration in this field.•Same As- Select a day from the drop-down to copy its hours to the current day.•Scheduling Notes- Enter any notes you'd like the employees to see in their scheduling confirmation text.•Employee Notes- If employees enter notes in their confirmation text for this week, they will appear here. ClickClear Notificationsto acknowledge and clear the alert. ClickClearto permanently delete the note. 
- Below is a guide explaining each option that is available while configuring these hours:- This button completely deletes this weeks schedule for this employee(s) or asset(s).- Click this button to redo this schedule. This will clear any hours that are already entered.- This button resets the hours to the Default Scheduling Hours. The Default Scheduling Hours are configured in Scheduling Settings.or-These options appear on each day of the week. Select either of these buttons to clear the hours for that day only.- This option appears above each day of the week. Select this+button to separate hours for that day. This is useful if employees leave the job, then return at a later time.Example: Start 7am - End 10am / Start 1pm - End 3pm 
- Once all hours are entered, clickSave.Could not display content 
- (Optional) Once the hours are saved, you have some additional options to adjust hours:- You can make adjustments by clickingDetails. This will take you back to the screen to configure hours.- For additional adjustments, select the employee or assets hours box. You can select the hours from a single day, multiple days, or clickto include everything. Then make changes using theicons.- Click this icon to cancel all selections.- Click this icon to acknowledge any scheduling notes and clear the notification.- This icon copies the selected hours to another employee or asset.- This icon moves the selected employee(s)/asset(s) hours to a different project.- If one day's hours is selected, you can click this icon to copy those hours to another day.- This icon deletes the selected hours.Note: To use these icons,you must select which employees or assets hours will be effected by making sure theirHoursare clicked and highlighted green.These icons will only effect the hours that are selected.Example: 
- (Optional) You can send a confirmation text to employees individually by selecting theRadiobuttons next to their name, and click theicon.Note: While using theicon, a text will send to all employees that are selected.Example: 
- (Optional) You can send a confirmation text to all employees who are scheduled by clickingReady SMS, Send Schedule, then clickYes.Note:ClickingReady SMSwill send a text toALL EMPLOYEESwho are scheduled acrossALL PROJECTS.

data.title: How Do I Use The All Projects View While Scheduling?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to use the All Projects view to schedule Employees and Assets.
data.body:
The All Projects view allows you to schedule Employees and Assets while being able to easily view other project schedules. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to utilize this view! 

# Required
 In order to use the Scheduling module, you must have the Full Scheduling Access role enabled. 

# Here are the steps to use the All Projects view while scheduling:

- Once you navigate to the Weekly Scheduling module, click theAll Projectstab. 
- To start scheduling, click on the project that you need to schedule.Note:You can search for projects and narrow down projects to choose from by clickingProject Filters. 
- Once you click the project that you need to schedule, click anEmployeeorAssetto schedule on the right hand side.Note:ClickSelect Multipleto choose several employees at once. Multi-select each employee you want to schedule, then clickSchedule Selectedto apply hours. UseEmployee FiltersorAsset Filtersto quickly search and narrow down your list.Additional Note:If using employee scheduling groups, click theGroupstab to schedule a group. You can also clickGroup Filtersto search for specific groups. 
- After selecting employees or assets to schedule, set their hours, break times, and add notes using the guide below:•Start- For each day, select the start time in this field.•End- For each day, select the end time in this field.•Break Time- For each day, select their break duration in this field.•Same As- Select a day from the drop-down to copy its hours to the current day.•Scheduling Notes- Enter any notes you'd like the employees to see in their scheduling confirmation text.•Employee Notes- If employees enter notes in their confirmation text for this week, they will appear here. ClickClear Notificationsto acknowledge and clear the alert. ClickClearto permanently delete the note. 
- Below is a guide explaining each option that is available while configuring these hours:- This button completely deletes this weeks schedule for this employee(s) or asset(s).- Click this button to redo this schedule. This will clear any hours that are already entered.- This button resets the hours to the Default Scheduling Hours. The Default Scheduling Hours are configured in Scheduling Settings.or-These options appear on each day of the week. Select either of these buttons to clear the hours for that day only.- This option appears above each day of the week. Select this+button to separate hours for that day. This is useful if employees leave the job, then return at a later time.Example: Start 7am - End 10am / Start 1pm - End 3pm 
- Once all hours are entered, clickSave. 
- (Optional) Once the hours are saved, you have some additional options:- Click this icon to delete the schedule for this project only.- This option will highlight this project green on the right hand side. This is a visual to mark which projects have already been scheduled.- Click these options to view eitherScope of WorkorScheduling Notes.- You can make adjustments by clickingDetails. This will take you back to the screen to configure hours.- For additional adjustments, select the employee or assets hours box. You can select the hours from a single day, multiple days, or clickto include everything. Then make changes using theicons.- Click this icon to cancel all selections. 
- (Optional) After you select which hours you need to change, you have the following icons to adjust time:- This icon copies the selected hours to another employee or asset.- This icon moves the selected employee(s)/asset(s) hours to a different project.- If one day's hours is selected, you can click this icon to copy those hours to another day.- This icon deletes the selected hours.Note: To use these icons,you must select which employees or assets hours will be effected by making sure theirHoursare clicked and highlighted green.These icons will only effect the hours that are selected.Example: 
- (Optional) Once your schedule is ready, you can send a confirmation text to all employees who are scheduled by clickingReady SMS, Send Schedule, then clickYes.NOTE:ClickingReady SMSwill send a text toALL EMPLOYEESwho are scheduled acrossALL PROJECTS.

data.title: How Do I Add A Lead?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to add a Lead to FieldFlo's CRM module.
data.body:
Creating Leads is made simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to add new Leads, you must have the Can Add Leads role enabled. 

# Here are the steps to add a Lead:

- On your left main menu, clickCRM,then clickLeads. 
- On the top right, click +Add Lead. 
- The ADD LEADpop-out will appear. Enter the following information for your new Lead and clickSave:• Lead Number- You can type a new Lead number in the text field, or follow click the icons below:- Click this to auto increment the Lead Number from the last Lead that was entered.- Click this to copy the last Lead Number that was entered.• Lead Name- Enter the name of this Lead. 
- Project Template(Optional) -Choose a Project Template from the drop-down. This will control what information is entered in the Project Details when this Lead turns into a Project. 
- Once you clickSave, you can find your Lead by using the search field within the mainLeadsscreen.

You can also clickGroup Filtersto search for specific groups. 
- After selecting employees or assets to schedule, set their hours, break times, and add notes using the guide below:•Start- For each day, select the start time in this field.•End- For each day, select the end time in this field.•Break Time- For each day, select their break duration in this field.•Same As- Select a day from the drop-down to copy its hours to the current day.•Scheduling Notes- Enter any notes you'd like the employees to see in their scheduling confirmation text.•Employee Notes- If employees enter notes in their confirmation text for this week, they will appear here. ClickClear Notificationsto acknowledge and clear the alert. ClickClearto permanently delete the note. 
- Below is a guide explaining each option that is available while configuring these hours:- This button completely deletes this weeks schedule for this employee(s) or asset(s).- Click this button to redo this schedule. This will clear any hours that are already entered.- This button resets the hours to the Default Scheduling Hours. The Default Scheduling Hours are configured in Scheduling Settings.or-These options appear on each day of the week. Select either of these buttons to clear the hours for that day only.- This option appears above each day of the week. Select this+button to separate hours for that day. This is useful if employees leave the job, then return at a later time.Example: Start 7am - End 10am / Start 1pm - End 3pm 
- Once all hours are entered, clickSave. 
- (Optional) Once the hours are saved, you have some additional options:- Click this icon to delete the schedule for this project only.- This option will exit out of this project's schedule, allowing you to choose another project to start scheduling.- This option will highlight this project green on the right hand side. This is a visual to mark which projects have already been scheduled.- Click these options to view eitherScope of WorkorScheduling Notes.- You can make adjustments by clicking directly on the employee or assetsGrey Circle. This will take you back to the screen to configure hours.- For additional adjustments, select the employee or assetsRadio Button. You can select the bubble from a single day, multiple days, or clickto include everything. Then make changes using theicons.- Click this icon to cancel all selections. 
- (Optional) After you select which hours you need to change, you have the following icons to adjust time:- This icon copies the selected hours to another employee or asset.- This icon moves the selected employee(s)/asset(s) hours to a different project.- If one day's hours is selected, you can click this icon to copy those hours to another day.- This icon deletes the selected hours.Note: To use these icons, you must select which employees or assets hours will be effected by making sure theirRadiobutton is clicked.Example:

data.title: How Do I Set Up Scheduling Settings?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to set up Scheduling Settings and the purpose of each setting.
data.body:
Setting up Scheduling Settings gives you options to configure how the schedule is received, and how the schedule acts as you create it. This article will show you exactly what each setting does! 

# Required
 In order to set up Scheduling Settings, you must have the Full Scheduling Access role enabled. 

# Here are the steps to set up Scheduling Settings:

- On your left main menu, clickScheduling,then clickSettings. 
- Configure the followingSchedule to Employeessettings:• SMS- This will send aTextto all employees that are scheduled.• Email- This will send anEmailto all employees that are scheduled.• Confirmation- This will give the employee an option to enter their pin and confirm the schedule sent to them. 
- Configure the followingScheduling Optionssetting:•Send crew names in dispatch in scheduling -Selecting this will include all other employee names that are scheduled for that job in the scheduling text. 
- Configure theRed when hours hitsetting. Select an amount of hours from the drop-down.Note:The employees name will turn red once they are scheduled for this amount of hours. 
- Set up theDefault Weekly Start Daysetting. Choose the day from the drop-down.Note:The day that is selected will be the first day of the week that shows when scheduling hours. 
- Set up the Default Scheduling Hours by configuring theStart, End,andBreak Timefor each day.Note:The times that are selected here will be the default times that show up when you start to schedule hours.

data.title: How Do I Use Scheduling?
data.description: This article will show you how to schedule employees and assets using FieldFlō's Scheduling module.
data.body:
Creating a weekly schedule for employees and assets is made simple with FieldFlō. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to utilize this feature! 

# Required
 In order to use the Scheduling module, you must have the Full Scheduling Access role enabled. 

# Information
 Before you create your schedule, you may want to check your Scheduling Settings so the schedule works and sends the way you would like. You can refer to the article below to learn about Scheduling Settings! 

 How Do I Set Up Scheduling Settings? If you're needing to schedule an employee for one day only, you can refer to the article below! 

 How Do I Use Daily Scheduling? 

# Here are the steps to use Scheduling:

- On your left main menu, clickScheduling,then clickWeek. 
- Click theWeekdrop-down and select the week you're creating the schedule for. 
- ClickOpen. 
- Once your schedule opens, you have the following options to configure on the top of your screen:Type- You can selectCrew,Asset, orAll. This is depicting what you're scheduling.Set Day-You can select a day from the drop-down to create the schedule for that day only. 
- Start scheduling by using theProject,All Projects, orCrewtabs. For detailed instructions on how to use each view, you can click on the buttons below!How Do I Use The Project View While Scheduling?How Do I Use The All Projects View While Scheduling?How Do I Use The Crew View While Scheduling? 
- (Optional) After sending the Scheduling Verification text, you can track the status using the guide below:- This weeks schedule was accepted by the employee via text.- This weeks schedule was denied by the employee via text.- This weeks schedule was sent to the employee via text, but it has not been accepted or denied.- This weeks schedule was not sent to the employee.Note:You can make changes to the schedule by adjusting the hours, then resending the scheduling verification text to the effected employees.

data.title: How Do I Use The Link Data Object?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Link data object within FieldFlō's form builder module.
data.body:
The Link data object is a great way to include hyperlinks within a form. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to add this to a custom form! 

# Required
 In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled. 

# Here are the steps to use the Link data object:

- Drag and drop theLinkdata object to the desired spot in the center of your screen. 
- Once it's dropped, the SAFETY SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and clickSave:•Link Name- This is the title of the hyperlink. Enter a name in the text field.•URL- Enter the URL for the hyperlink in the text field.•Open in New Tab- If this option is selected, when the link is clicked it will open a new tab instead of opening in the tab they're currently on. 
- Once you clickSave,you have the the following options:•Blue pdf square- When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.•Settings Gear Icon- Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.•Trash can icon- Click this icon to delete the Safety data object.

data.title: How Do I Use The Safety Data Object?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Safety data object within FieldFlō's form builder module.
data.body:
The Safety data object is a great way to log incidents, Near Misses, Stop Works, and Injuries. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to add this option to a custom form! 

# Required
 In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled. 

# Here are the steps to use the Safety data object:

- Drag and drop theSafetydata object to the desired spot in the center of your screen. 
- Once it's dropped, the SAFETY SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and clickSave:•Incident, Near Miss, Stop Work, Injury- Select one of these options to depict which safety type you're needing to log.•Use Custom Labels- If this is selected, enter your customLabelandDescriptionin each text field.Note: If Injury is selected, you must add the "Person Selector / Pin Verify" data object. After it is added to the form, you can then select that data object from the "injured employee block" drop-down within the SAFETY SETTINGS. 
- Once you clickSave,you have the the following options:•Blue pdf square- When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.•Settings Gear Icon- Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.•Trash can icon- Click this icon to delete the Safety data object.

data.title: How Do I Use The Person Selector / Pin Verify Data Object?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Person Selector / Pin Verify data object within FieldFlō's form builder module.
data.body:
The Pin Selector / Pin Verify data object will allow you to choose employee names from a drop-down with an option to capture their signature. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to add this to a custom form! 

# Required
 In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled. 

# Here are the steps to use the Person Selector / Pin Verify data object:

- Drag and drop thePerson Selector / Pin Verifydata object to the desired spot in the center of your screen. 
- Once it's dropped, the PERSON SELECTOR SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and clickSave:•Required- Select this option to make this whole data object required to complete in order to close this form.•All Employees- Select this option to have all employee names show as drop-down options.•Can Login / Supervisors Only- Select this option to have only supervisors and employees who can login show as drop-down options•Pin Required- Select this option to make each employee enter their PIN in order to close this form.•Enter Pin- Select this option to capture the employees PIN. If selected, this option will not be required.•Anyone with Role 'Can validate anything with PIN' -Select this option to allow employees with the 'Can validate anything with PIN' role to PIN for other employees.•Project Supervisor- Select this option to make the Supervisor on that project be able to PIN for other employees.•Tag Employee/Form to the employee details- Selecting this option will make it so that every time an employees name is entered using this person selector, the form name will appear in the "Employee Form Tagging" tab within that employees profile. 
- Once you clickSave,you have the the following options:•Blue pdf square- When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.•Settings Gear Icon- Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.•Trash can icon- Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Add Production Tasks To A Project?
data.description: This article will show you how to add production tasks to a project.
data.body:
Adding production tasks to your project allows you to start tracking production rates. FieldFlō makes this process simple! This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to add production tasks to a project, you must have the following roles enabled: 
 • View All Projects or View Assigned Projects 
 • Can edit Production Tasks 

# Here are the steps to add production tasks to a project:

- On your left main menu, clickProjects. 
- You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Once you find your project, click anywhere on theProject. 
- Once your project opens up, clickView Detailsnext to Production Tracking. 
- Once your Production Dashboard opens, you can add tasks by clicking+ Add Task(s). 
- Once the ADD TASK(s) pop-up appears, you have the following options to configure and clickAdd:•Add to Phase- If Phases are used, select which phase that this task will be performed for. Otherwise, leave this field blank.•Filter by Task Group- You can filter the options to choose from by selecting a group. Once a group is selected, the list will show only tasks that are apart of that group. This will only work if you have task groups entered.•Filter by Task Name- You can use this search field to find your needed task.•Task Name- Select theRadiobutton next to each task that needs to be added. Once the radio button is selected, enter theTotal Scopeof how much area (UoM) this task will cover. 
- After you click save, you can edit or remove tasks by clicking the3 Dotsnext to the task and clickEditorRemove.

data.title: How Do I Complete The Production Tracking Form?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to complete the Production Tracking form.
data.body:
Completing the Production Tracking form is simple, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to complete the Production Tracking form, you must have production tracking enabled. Please refer to the article below to enable this feature! 

 How Do I Enable Production Tracking? 
 In order to complete the Production Tracking form, there must be tasks entered within this projects Production Tracking. In order to add tasks to a project, please refer to this article: 

 How Do I Add Production Tasks To A Project? 

# Here are the steps to complete the Production Tracking form:

- On your left main menu, clickProjects. 
- You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Once you find your project, click anywhere on theProject. 
- Once your project opens up, scroll down and click+ Add Form. 
- You can use theFilter Formssearch bar on the top to search for the form, or you can scroll to find your form. Once you locate the form, click on theRadiobutton next to the Production Tracking form and clickSave. 
- Click anywhere on theProduction Trackingform to open it up. 
- First click theDatedrop-down and select the correct date. Then select aSupervisorfrom the drop-down and enter thePIN. 
- For each task that was worked, enter the correct amount of UoM that was completed today, in theCompletedfield. 
- Click theHourstext box and enter the amount of hours that was spent working on each task. 
- Once theCompletedandHoursboxes are filled out ,Save & Close(to go back to dashboard) or clickSave(to stay on the form). 
- If your form is complete, you can close and submit this form by clicking theClose Formicon on the right side of the form. The form will also close when the End Day button is selected 
- Now this project's Production Tracking is up to date! You can view the current production statistics by clicking theView Detailsnext to Production Tracking.Note: In order for the Production Dashboard to update, the production tracking form must be closed.

data.title: How Do I Add/Edit Tasks For Production Tracking?
data.description: This article will show you how to add and edit tasks for Production Tracking.
data.body:
Adding and editing tasks for FieldFlō's Production Tracking is simple, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to add and edit tasks for Production Tracking, you must have the Can edit Production Tasks role enabled. 

# Information

# What is a Task and What is the Purpose?
 • Tasks are the specific type of work that will be preformed on a project. 

 • Each task will include a Unit of Measure, this allows you to estimate how many units can be completed per hour. 

 • After tasks are configured, add tasks to that project within a project's Production Tracking. These should be the tasks that will be completed on that specific project only. 

 • Fill out the Production Tracking form on the project each day. This will allow you to keep track of the estimated hours compared to the actual hours of each task. 

# Here are the steps to add tasks for Production Tracking:

- On your left main menu, clickAdminthen clickPortal Admins. 
- Scroll to the bottom and under PRODUCTION TRACKING, clickTASKS. 
- Once the Tasks screen opens, click+ Add Newon the top right. 
- Enter the following information for your new task and clickSave:•Task Name -This is the display name of the task.•Task Description -Enter a brief description of what this task involves.•Position Code- Select a position to associate with this task. If no position is selected, this task will not be included in Job Costing or Proposal Builder.•Estimated Production Rate / Hr -Enter the estimate of how much work can be completed per hour.• UoM Code -Enter a Unit of Measure and press enter on your keyboard. This will allow a maximum of 4 characters.Example: ft, sqft, m, sqm•UoM Name- Enter the full name of the Unit of Measure and press enter on your keyboard.Example: Feet, Square Feet, Meters, Square Meters•Task Groups- If you would like to group tasks together, type in the group name and press enter on your keyboard. 

# Here are the steps to edit a Task for Production Tracking:

- Once you're in the Production Tracking Tasks page, click the3 Dotsnext to the desired task and clickEdit.Note:You can clickMove to Top,Move 1 Up,Move 1 Down, orMove to Bottom.This is how you arrange the order of your tasks in this list. 
- Once the Edit Task window appears, you can make your changes to any field and clickSave.

data.title: How Do I Enable Production Tracking?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to enable Production Tracking.
data.body:
Enabling Production Tracking is simple, this article will walk you through the steps on how to do this! 

 Production Tracking allows you to track production rates for each job. This tool helps you keep a close eye on your estimated vs your actual production. Production rates will be updated each day by using the Production Tracking form. 

# Required
 In order to enable Production Tracking, you must have Super Admin access. 

# Information
 After enabling Production Tracking, you must add production tasks in order to start utilizing this feature. Please refer to the article below to learn how to add tasks! 

 How Do I Add/Edit Tasks For Production Tracking? 

# Here are the steps to enable Production Tracking:

- On your left main menu, clickCompany. 
- Scroll down to the bottom, selectEnable Production Trackingand clickSave. 
- Now you can start to add tasks and view Production Tracking on your project dashboard!

data.title: How Do I Use The Question/Mass Group Radio Buttons Data Object?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to use the Question / Mass Group Radio Buttons data object in FieldFlō's form builder module.
data.body:
The Question / Mass Group Radio Buttons data object is a great way to create a multiple choice question with plenty of answer choices, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled. 

# Here are the steps to use the Question / Mass Group Radio Buttons data object:

- Drag and drop theQuestion / Mass Group Radio Buttonsdata object to the center of your screen. 
- Once it's dropped, the QUESTION / MASS GROUP RADIO SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and clickSave:•Question- Enter your question in the text field.•Required- Select/Unselect this radio button. If it's selected, this question will be required to answer in order to close the form.•Radio Button Names- Click+ Radio Buttonfor each answer option. Enter each answer in the text field.•Email Alert- Select/Unselect thisRadiobutton for each answer. If this is selected, an email notification will be sent each time this option is selected.•INFO POPUP -Enter information/description in the text field and select the activeRadiobutton. This will make an "i" icon appear and if a user hovers over this, they will see the information that was entered. 
- If an Email Alert option is selected, you can choose who receives the alert by entering any of the following options and clickSave:•Email Template- Select an option from this drop-down to choose the format of the email alert.•Email Group- If Email Groups are configured, you can select a group from this drop-down and whoever is within the group will receive the email alert.•Key Project Personnel- You can select Project Manager, Supervisor, or Assigned Employees. This will send the email alert to those employees if they are entered in the project's details.•Admins- Select the Super Admin radio button and this will send the email alert to all Super Admins.•Others- You can enter a specific email in this text box, the email alerts will be sent to this email. To add more specific emails, click the blue+button. 
- Once you clickSave,you have the the following options:•Blue pdf square- When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.•Settings Gear Icon- Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.•Trash can icon- Click this icon to delete the data object.

- Drag and drop theQuestion / Radio Buttonsdata object to the center of your screen. 
- Once it's dropped, the QUESTION / RADIO BUTTONS' SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and clickSave:•Questionnaire Name -Enter the questionnaire name in the text field. This will be a label that shows above your question.•Hide- Select/Unselect this radio button. If it's selected, this will hide the questionnaire name from showing on the form.•Radio Button Titles- These are the answer options for your question. Enter each answer in the text field, you can also click+ Radio Buttonto add more answers.•Email Alert- Select/Unselect thisRadiobutton for each answer. If this is selected, an email notification will be sent each time this option is selected.•Questions- Enter your question in the text field. You can add more questions by clicking+ Question.•Required- Select/Unselect this radio button. If it's selected, this question will be required to answer in order to close the form.•INFO POPUP -Enter information/description in the text field and select the activeRadiobutton. This will make an "i" icon appear and if a user hovers over this, they will see the information that was entered. 
- If an Email Alert option is selected, you can choose who receives the alert by entering any of the following options and clickSave:•Email Template- Select an option from this drop-down to choose the format of the email alert.•Email Group- If Email Groups are configured, you can select a group from this drop-down and whoever is within the group will receive the email alert.•Key Project Personnel- You can select Project Manager, Supervisor, or Assigned Employees. This will send the email alert to those employees if they are entered in the project's details.•Admins- Select the Super Admin radio button and this will send the email alert to all Super Admins.•Others- You can enter a specific email in this text box, the email alerts will be sent to this email. To add more specific emails, click the blue+button. 
- Once you clickSave,you have the the following options:•Blue pdf square- When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.•Settings Gear Icon- Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.•Trash can icon- Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Use The Timesheet Employee Pin Populate Data Object?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to use the Timesheet Employee Pin Populate data object in FieldFlō's form builder module.
data.body:
The Timesheet Employee Pin Populate data object is an easy way to capture signatures from every employee on a project's timesheet, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled. 

# Information
 When this data object is used, it will automatically populate this form with every employee listed on the project's timesheet. You will also have the option to add additional employees. 

# Here are the steps to use the Timesheet Employee Pin Populate data object:

- Drag and drop theTimesheet Employee Pin Populatedata object to the center of your screen. 
- Once it's dropped, the TIMESHEET EMPLOYEE POPULATE SETTINGS will appear. Once all the following settings are configured, clickSave:•Employee Block Name- Enter a title in the text field to label this data object.•Required- Select/Unselect thisRadiobutton. If it's selected, this data object will be required to complete in order to close the form on a project.•Enter Pin- Select/Unselect thisRadiobutton. If it's selected, each employee will be able to enter their pin number to verify.•SMS Verify- Select/Unselect thisRadiobutton. If it's selected, you will be able to send a verification text to each employee.•Anyone with Role `Can validate anything with PIN` -Select/Unselect thisRadiobutton. If it's selected, anyone with the "Can validate anything with PIN" role will be able to enter their pin verification for other employees.•Project Supervisor -Select/Unselect thisRadiobutton. If it's selected, the Supervisor on this project will be able to enter their pin verification for other employees.•Tag Employee/Form to the employees details- Select/Unselect thisRadiobutton. If it's selected, each time an employee is entered in this data object it will be logged within the employees profile under the "Employee Form Tagging" tab. 
- Once you clickSave,you have the the following options:•Blue pdf square- When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.•Settings Gear Icon- Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.•Trash can icon- Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Can I Track Prevailing Wage On A Timesheet?
data.description: This article will show you how to track prevailing wage on a timesheet.
data.body:

- Scroll down and click thePayroll Informationtab. 
- ClickIs this Job a Prevailing Wage Jobdrop-down and selectYes,then clickSave. 
- Now you are able to select an employeesPrevailing Wageon this projects timesheet!

data.title: How Do I Use Form Builder?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to use the Form Builder module.
data.body:
FieldFlō's Form Builder is a great way to build custom forms for employees to complete, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled. 

# Information
 Form Builder allows you to drag and drop data objects from the right-hand side of the screen into the center. Each time you drop a data object, you are adding it to the form, customizing the data that will be displayed, and configuring the specific settings for that object. This process helps you build and tailor your form according to your needs. 

# Here are the steps to use Form Builder:

- On the left main menu, clickAdminthen clickForm Builder. 
- You can click an existing form from the list to edit it, OR create a new form by clicking+ Add New Form. 
- On the top, you have the following fields to complete: 
- Form Name 
- Form LayoutSingle Page- Will only include one section (page).Multi Page- Can add multiple sections (pages). 
- StatusInactive- Will not be available to add to projects.Active- Can add to projects after enabling it in Global Form Settings or Project Form Settings. 

 4. If multiple sections are being created, you can name each section by clicking the Pencil icon and add sections by clicking + Add Section. 

 Note : The Pencil Icon will appear once you hover over the section name on the left hand side. 

 5. Once your form is built, you have additional options. Click the 3 Dots , then click Form Settings . You will have the following settings to configure and click Save : 

- PDF HeaderActive- Will display a general header on top of the PDF.Inactive -Will not display any header on top of the PDF. 
- Allow MultipleActive- Will allow multiple of these forms to be open on a project at once.Inactive- Will not allow multiple of these forms to be open on a project at once. 
- Company Address on PDFShow- Will show your company's address on the PDF version.Hide -WiIl not show your company's address on the PDF version. 
- Element Spacing on PDFNormal- PDF will display normal spacing between data objects.Reduced- PDF will have data objects appear closer together. 
- Image Display Options on PDFFull Page -On the PDF version, each image will be displayed on a separate page for maximum visibility.Condensed -On the PDF version, each image is 1/3 of the pages height.Grid- On the PDF version, Images will be displayed in rows of 2. Each row is 1/4 of the pages height 
- Same As PreviousEnabled -Allows you to copy information entered from the previous day.Disabled -Will not allow you to copy information entered from a previous day. 
- PDF orientationPortrait- When the form is exported to a PDF, it will display vertically.Landscape- When the form is exported to a PDF, it will display horizontally. 

 6. Once all data objects are added and all correct settings are applied, click the blue Save Form button on the top right. 

# Information
 For information on how to utilize this form on your projects, you can refer to the article below! 

 How Do I Add A Form I Built To My Project?

data.title: How Do I Complete A Daily Field Report
data.description: This article show you how to complete a Daily Field Report form on a project.
data.body:
Completing a Daily Field Report form is a great way to capture details about the work that was preformed on a project, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to complete the Daily Field Report, you must have the following roles enabled: 
 • View All Projects or View Assigned Projects 
 • Add/Edit Open Forms 

# Here are the steps to complete a Daily Field Report:

- On your left main menu, clickProjects. 
- You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Once you find your project, click anywhere on theProject. 
- Once your project opens up, scroll down and click+ Add Form. 
- Use theFilter Formssearch bar on the top to search for the form, or you can scroll to find your form. Once you locate the form, click on theRadiobutton next to the Daily Field Report and clickSave. 
- Click anywhere on theDaily Field Reportto open it up. 
- Complete the General Information section by clicking the following drop-downs and select an option:•Supervisor -Shows the supervisor that is within Project Details, you can select a different supervisor from this drop-down if needed.•Project Manager -Shows the project manager that is within Project Details, you can select a different project manager from this drop-down if needed.•Date -Shows todays date, you can click the drop-down and select a new date if needed. 
- (Optional) Complete the Scope of Work section by clicking the following drop-downs and select an option:•Scope Received•Scope Date•Structure 
- Enter the requiredWork Completed Todayfield. 
- (Optional) Answer the following End of Shift Review questions:•What went right?•What can be improved? 
- Click theYesorNoradio buttons under Incident, Near Miss, and Stop Work.Note:If Yes is clicked, select the type of Incident, Near Miss, or Stop Work from the drop-down and describe what happened in the text field below. 
- (Optional) Answer the following fields:•Goals for Tomorrow•Goals for the Week•Action Required•Project Notes or Special Considerations•Meeting Log•Visitors•Workflow•Bulk Equipment in use this Day 
- (Optional) If ACM is handled, enter an option from the following drop-downs:•Detected•Date Tested•Survey Date 
- (Optional) If Lead is handled, enter an option from theDetectedandDate Testeddrop-downs. 
- (Optional) If Mold is handled, complete the following fields:•Detected•Date Tested•Notes related to Environmental testing•Estimated Completion Date•Days Remaining on Project (Including Demobilization) 
- (Optional) Complete the RRP and/or Abatement Procedures section by selecting theRadiobutton next to each task that applies to todays work. 
- (Optional) Enter the following information for each field:•Work Area Locations•# of cleaning cloths utilized•What cleaning verification did you pass on? 
- (Optional) You can also attach images by clickingChoose File. 
- Lastly, clickSave.

data.title: (IOS App ONLY) How Do I Complete A Daily Timesheet
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to complete a timesheet on the FieldFlo IOS app.
data.body:
Completing a timesheet on FieldFlō's IOS app is simple, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Here are the steps to complete a timesheet on FieldFlō's app:

- Once your app opens, you can search for your project using the search field on top. Or you can scroll to find your project, once you've found the project click on the Project Name to open it up. 
- ClickStart Dayon the bottom right of the screen. 
- Click anywhere on theDaily Timesheetto open it up. 
- Select theForeman/ Superintendent Signature,select the name then click theAddemployee icon. 
- Once the Supervisor has been added, click theAddemployee button on the bottom right of your screen. 
- Click all theEmployeesthat need to be added to the timesheet and clickSave. 
- Click theSelect Allbutton on top of the employee list and select theStarticon. 
- The time has started if the Clock next to the Employee's name turns green and the wordTRACKINGappears. 
- To stop time at the end of the day, click theSelect Allbutton and select theStopicon on the bottom of the screen. 
- Enter the following information:•Did they take a break?• Verify if the above information is correct• Enter your Pin•Submit 
- Now the time has been stopped.Each individual employee completes the following fields by selectingVerifynext to their names:•Select Yes or No for each question• Verify if the above information is correct• Enter your Pin• Submit 
- Everyone on the timesheet should have theVerifiedcheck mark next to their name. 
- ToCloseandSubmitthe Timesheet, clickBack. 
- Select theEnd Dayat the bottom of the screen. 
- ClickYeson theEnd Day?question to Submit your Timesheet. 16. Verify that all forms are closed.

data.title: How Do I Choose Skills For An Employee And What Is The Purpose
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to choose skills for an employee and will explain what this can be used for.
data.body:
FieldFlo makes it easy to choose specific skills for an employee, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to choose skills for an employee, you must have the Edit Employee role enabled. 

# Information
 • Choosing skills for an employee allows you to keep track of which tasks an employee is capable of completing. You can completely customize these skills to the specific type of work your company preforms. 
 Ex: Demolition Supervisor, Demolition Burner, Abatement Laborer, CDL Driver, ect. 

 • This will also allow you to apply filters to your employee list to see which employees have certain skills. 

# Here are the steps to associate skills with an employee:

- On your left main menu, clickEmployees. 
- Once you're in the employe module, you can find the employee you need by typing their name in the search bar or filter your options by theStatusdropdown. If you would like additional filtering options click the blue+ Filterbutton. 
- Once you find the employee you need, click anywhere on theEmployeename to open up their profile. 
- Under theEmployee Detailstab, scroll down to the Skills section and select theRadiobutton next to each skill that this employee is associated to. 
- Lastly, scroll down and clickSave.

data.title: How Do Email Project And Company Documents
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to email project and company documents.
data.body:
FieldFlō allows you to email documents straight from your portal, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to email documents from FieldFlō, you must have the following roles enabled: 
 • View All Projects or View Assigned Projects 
 • Edit/Delete/Share Link 

# Here are the steps to email project and company documents:

- On your left main menu, clickProjects. 
- You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Once you find your project, click anywhere on theProject. 
- Once your project opens up, click the3 Dotsthen clickDocuments. 
- Click the3 Dotsnext to the document that you need to send and clickEmail. You can email company documents by clicking theCompany Documentsfolder and follow these same steps. 
- (Optional) You can email multiple documents at once by selecting theRadiobuttons next to each document, click the3 Dotson the top right of all the documents and clickEmail. 
- Once you get to the File Sharing pop-out,you can select anEmail Groupfrom the drop-down and/or enter a specific email in theAdd Emailbox.Note: You can add more emails by clicking the+blue button 
- Lastly click theTemplatedrop-down, select a template and clickSend. 

# Information
 You can also email company documents from the Company module. This is faster if you're looking to send only company documents. 

# Required
 In order to email documents from the company module, you must have Super Admin access 

# Here are the steps to send a company document from the company module:

- On your left main menu, clickCompany. 
- Select the3 dotsand clickCompany Documents. 
- Select the3 Dotsnext to the document that you need to email and clickEmail. 
- (Optional) You can email multiple documents at once by selecting theRadiobuttons next to each document, click the3 Dotson the top right of all the documents and clickEmail. 
- Once you get to the File Sharing pop-out,you can select anEmail Groupfrom the drop-down and/or enter a specific email in theAdd Emailbox.Note: You can add more emails by clicking the+blue button 
- Lastly click theTemplatedrop-down, select a template and clickSend.

data.title: How Do I Complete A T&M Form
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to complete a T&M form on a project.
data.body:
Completing a T&M form is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to complete a T&M form, you must have the following roles enabled: 
 • View All Projects or View Assigned Projects 
 • Add/Edit Open Forms 

# Here are the steps to complete a T&M form:

- On your left main menu, clickProjects. 
- You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Once you find your project, click anywhere on theProject. 
- Once your project opens up, scroll down and click+ Add Form. 
- You can use theFilter Formssearch bar on the top to search, or you can scroll to find your form. Once you locate the form, click on theRadiobutton next to the T&M form and clickSave. 
- Click anywhere on theT&MFormto open it up. 
- First click theSupervisordrop-down and select the project supervisor, then click+ New Dayand select a date from the calendar.Note:• The "Date Created" drop-down will show todays date, you can always change this date by clicking theDrop-downand select a new date.• You can select theARCHIVEbutton to copy from a previous T&M form• You can select theCOSTbutton to see previous T&M forms and the costs. 
- Click the+ Timebutton for each employee that you need to log time for.Note:• Before selecting+ Time, you can click theNewdrop-down and select a date to copy the time entered from a previous T&M form.• Before selecting+Time, you can click theNewdrop-down and choosePull From Timesheettocopy the time from this projects timesheet.• If the options above are selected, click+ Timeand this will enter the copied data. 
- Now you can enter or change the following employee information:•Employee•Position•Time -Amount of hours•Hourly Cost•Description of Work•Employee Notes 
- Click the+ Materialbutton for each piece of material.Note:• Before selecting+ Material, you can click theNewdrop-down and choose a date to copy the material entered from a previous T&M form. If this option is selected, click+ Materialand this will enter the copied data. 
- Now you can enter or change the following material information:•Item Name/No•Qty•Item Cost•Comments 
- You can enterNotesor addImages. 
- Lastly, enter the following information and clickSave:•Approved By•Signature- This signature is for whoever is approving this T&M form.Note:You can add more approvers and signatures by clicking+ Signature.

data.title: How Do I Complete A Disciplinary Action Form
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add and complete a Disciplinary Action form on a project.
data.body:
FieldFlō's Disciplinary Action form is an easy way to log and keep track of employee compliance, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to complete this form! 

# Required
 In order to complete a Disciplinary Action form, you must have the following roles enabled: 
 • View All Projects or View Assigned Projects 
 • Add/Edit Open Forms 

# Here are the steps to complete a Disciplinary Action form:

- On your left main menu, clickProjects. 
- You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Once you find your project, click anywhere on theProject. 
- Once your project opens up, scroll down and click+ Add Form. 
- You can use theFilter Formssearch bar on the top to search for the form, or you can scroll to find your form. Once you locate the form, click on theRadiobutton next to the Disciplinary Action form and clickSave. 
- Click anywhere on yourFormto open it up. 
- Once your form opens, choose an option from the followingdrop-downs:•Supervisor•Date -This will show todays date. If this needs to be changed, you can click the drop-down and select the new date.•Employee -This is the employee that's receiving the disciplinary action.•Incident Type 
- Enter theDescription of IncidentandCorrective Plan/Action. 
- Under theAcknowledge Bysection, enter the following mandatory fields:•Supervisorand theirSignature•Employee Signature•Witnessand theirSignature 
- (Optional) You can also attach Images of theIncident. 
- Lastly, clickSave.

data.title: How Do I Complete A PSI/JHA/SPA Form
data.description: This article will show you how to complete the PSI/JHA/SPA form.
data.body:
FieldFlō's PSI/JHA/SPA form is a great way to acknowledge project site safety. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to complete this form! 

# Required

 In order to complete a PSI/JHA/SPA form, you must have the following roles enabled: 
 • View All Projects or View Assigned Projects 
 • Add/Edit Open Forms 
 Here is a quick training video on how to complete a PSI/JHA/SPA form: 

# Here are the steps to complete a PSI/JHA/SPA form:

- On your left main menu, clickProjects. 
- You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Once you find your project, click anywhere on theProject. 
- Once your project opens up, scroll down and click+ Add Form. 
- You can use theFilter Formssearch bar on the top to search for the form, or you can scroll to find your form. Once you locate the form, click on theRadiobutton next to the PSI/JHA/SPA and clickSave. 
- Click anywhere on yourFormto open it up. 
- Within the firstGeneral Informationtab, the following fields are required:•Task Location• Muster / Meeting Point•Supervisor- Chose the supervisors name from the drop-down and enter theirby clicking theENTER PINbutton. 
- (Optional) Click on theNearest Hospitaltab and enter the following information:•Name•Address•City•State•ZIP Code•Phone Number 
- (Optional) Click on theReviewtab and select theRadiobuttons next to each hazard that you will encounter during todays work. 
- (Optional) Click on theEvacuation Plantab to enter anyNotesor attach anyImages. 
- Click on theTask Steps / Hazard & Control / Risktab. Click the+ Add Taskbutton and chose all of the tasks that apply to todays work. You can also click the+ Add Custombutton to add any additional tasks.Note: If+ Add Customis selected, enter theTask Steps, Hazard,Control,andRisk Ratingwithin the empty boxes. 
- Click on theWeather Questionstab and check theYesorNo Radiobuttonsnext to the following required questions:•I have reviewed the weather conditions with the crew?•I have reviewed the road conditions with the crew?•I have reviewed the OSHA Heat Index? 
- Click on theSignaturestab. Click+ Add Employeefor each employee on the project, then chose each name from theDrop-downsand clickSave & Close. 
- Now click back into the PSI/JHA/SPA and within theSignaturestab, clickSelect All / Deselect All. 
- Once all employees are selected, click theSMSPhone Icon to send a verification text to each employee. You can also clickEnter Pinto manually verify. 
- (Optional) Click theOthertab and select theAdequateorInadequateradio buttons for each statement. 
- Lastly, clickSave & Close.

data.title: How Do I Run A Basic Plus (Payroll) Report And What Does It Include?
data.description: This article will cover how to run a Basic Plus (Payroll) Report and will explain the different data points that it includes.
data.body:
FieldFlō's Basic Plus Report is an easy way to view payroll data, this article will show you the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to run the Basic Plus Report, you must have Super Admin access. 

# Here are the steps to run a Basic Plus (Payroll) Report:

- On your left main menu, clickPayroll. 
- The payroll menu will appear, clickPayroll Exports. 
- Enter the following mandatory fields that are marked with a red * :•Type- Basic Plus Report•Date From- Enter the date that you need this report to begin from. 
- Select theRadio Buttonnext to each project you need to include in the report.Note:You can filter your options by the following:StatusAll,Active Only,Closed Only, orOn Hold OnlyClientProject Type 
- Once you have your projects selected, select theRadio Buttonnext to theEmployeesthat you need included. Select/Unselect theInclude Deleted Employeesradio button, if selected the report will include deleted employees.Note:You can filter your employee options byAll, Regular,andTempemployees. 
- Once you have your desired projects and employees selected, click the blueRun Reportbutton on the top right of your screen. 
- The Generating Report pop-out will appear click eitherReturn to Export PageorLeave and be Notified,whichever you prefer. 
- Once the report opens up, the firstProject Hourstab will show the following data:•Project Name•Project Manager•Sum of Regular Hours- Shows all hours worked on the project within that week.•Total Employees- Shows the total amount of employees that worked on the project within that week. 
- (Optional) If you click theHours Workedtab, it will show the following data:•Employee Name•Regular Hours -Shows all non OT hours that were worked on the project within that week.•OT Hours -Shows how many OT hours that were worked on the project within that week.•Total Hours -Shows how many hours in total (OT and Regular) that were worked on the project within that week. 
- (Optional) If you click theBy Employeetab, it will show the following data:•Date Worked- Shows the exact day that the employee has hours for.•Project Number•Project Name•Project Manager•Project Type•Cost Code- This is the Cost Code to the Position that the employee clocked in with.• Cost Code Description- This is the Position name that the employee clocked in with.•Prevailing Wage Code- If Prevailing Wage was used, this is the code to the Prevailing Wage that the employee clocked in with.•Prevailing Wage Name- This is the name of the specific Prevailing Wage that the employee clocked in with.• Prevailing Wage Base Rate- This is the Base Rate of the Prevailing Wage that the employee clocked in with.•Prevailing Wage Fringe Rate- This is the Fringe Rate of the Prevailing Wage that the employee clocked in with.•Employee Number•Employee Full Name -Shows employees first and last name.•Regular Hours -Shows all non OT hours that were worked on the project within that week.•Per Diem- If Per Diem is owed to this employee, it will display "Per Diem". If no Per Diem is owed to the employee, this box will be blank.•Per Diem Status- Shows Approved, Pending, or will be blank depending on if Per Diem was approved for this employee.•Timesheet Note- If the supervisor had left a note on the timesheet, those notes will appear here.•Employee Note- If the employee had left a note on their verification text, those notes will appear here.

data.title: How Do I Run A Master Extended (Payroll) Report And What Does It Include
data.description: This article will show you how to run a Master Extended Report and will explain the different data points that this report shows.
data.body:
FieldFlō's Master Extended (Payroll) Report is a great report to use to view payroll information, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to run this report! 

# Required
 In order to run a Master Extended Report, you must have Super Admin access. 

# Here are the steps on how to run a Master Extended (Payroll) Report:

- On your left main menu, clickPayroll. 
- The payroll menu will appear, clickPayroll Exports. 
- Enter the following mandatory fields that are marked with a red * :•Type- Master Extended Report•Date From- Enter the date that you need this report to start at.•Date To -Enter the date that you need this report to end at. 
- Select theRadio Buttonnext to each project you need to include in the report.Note:You can filter your options by the following:StatusAll,Active Only,Closed Only, orOn Hold OnlyClientProject Type 
- Once you have your projects selected, select theRadio Buttonnext to theEmployeesthat you need included. Select/Unselect theInclude Deleted Employeesradio button, if selected the report will include deleted employees.Note:You can filter your employee options byAll, Regular,andTempemployees. 
- Once you have your desired projects and employees selected, click the blueRun Reportbutton on the top right of your screen. 
- The Generating Report pop-out will appear click eitherReturn to Export PageorLeave and be Notified,whichever you prefer. 
- Once the Master Extended Report opens up the firstDetailstab will give the following data:•Date- Exact day that the employee worked.•Employee- First and Last name of the employee who had hours within the timeframe.•Employee ID- The employee's ID that had hours within the timeframe.•Union Code ID- If an employee has a Union Code/ID entered within their profile, that code will show in this column.•Foreman / Superintendent- Shows the Foreman / Superintendent on this project.•Project Number- Project's Number that the employee had worked on.•Project Name- Name of the project that the employee had worked on.•Night Shift- This will display Yes or No depending on if this project was worked throughout the night.•Shift Length- This will display how long the shift was in hours.•Certified Payroll- Will display Yes or No depending on if this project used Certified Payroll.•Employee Note- If the employee had left a note on their verification text, those notes will appear here.•Timesheet Note- If the supervisor had left a note on the timesheet, those notes will appear here.•Injured- This will display Yes or No depending on if the employee or supervisor has marked them as injured when verifying their day.• Injured Verified By- Shows who verified the day in which the employee was injured.•Injured Verified Date/Time- Shows the date and exact time that this injury was verified at.•Regulated Break- Depending on if a break was taken, this will show Yes or No•Regulated Break Verified By- Shows who verified the employees Injury status.•Regulated Break Verified Date/Time -Shows the date and exact time that the injury status was verified.•Billable- Depending on if Billable is selected on the Timesheet, this will show Yes or No.•Position- Position that the employee was clocked in with.•Prevailing Wage Code- Shows the Prevailing Wage code for the type of Prevailing wage that the employee had clocked in with.•Prevailing Wage Name- Shows the Prevailing Wage name that the employee had clocked in with.•Prevailing Wage Base Rate- Shows the Base Rate of the Prevailing Wage that the employee had clocked in with.•Prevailing Wage Fringe Rate- Shows the Fringe Rate of the Prevailing Wage that the employee had clocked in with.•Phase Code- Shows the Phase Code to the Phase that was selected on the timesheet for this employee.•Phase- Shows the Phase name that was selected on the timesheet for this employee.•Total Hours- Total hours that this employee has worked on this project within the timeframe that was selected.•Total Hours (digits)- Shows Total Hours but in decimal form.•Check-in Time- If an employee checks in with the text message feature, this will show the exact date and time of the employees check in.•Start Time- Shows the start date and exact start time of this timesheet.•End Time- Shows the end date and exact end time of this timesheet.•Break Time- Shows the amount of time that the employees break was.•Time Verified By- Shows who verified the employees time.•Per Diem Type- Shows if it's Daily or Hourly Per Diem•Per Diem Amount- Shows the exact dollar amount of Per Diem owed within that timeframe.•Per Diem Cash Given- If per diem was given in cash and the amount was logged on the timesheet, that dollar amount will appear here.•Change Log -Shows Yes or No depending on if their time was edited.•Inserted via Adjuster -Shows Yes or No depending on if their time was entered/changed with the Timesheet Adjuster•Last Change Time Action By -If time was changed, this will show the last person who changed the time.•Original Start Date -If time was changed, this will show the original start date and start time before the changes were made.•Original End Date -If time was changed, this will show the original end date and end time before the changes were made. 
- (Optional) Clicking theBy Projecttab will give the following data:•Employee- First and Last name of the employee who had hours within the timeframe.•Project Number- Project's Number that the employee had worked on.•Project Name- Name of the project that the employee had worked on.•Total Hours- Total hours that this employee has worked on this project within the timeframe that was selected.•Total Hours (digits)- Shows Total Hours but in decimal form. 
- (Optional) Clicking theBy Employeetab will give the following data:•Employee- First and Last name of the employee who had hours within the timeframe.•Total Hours- Total hours that this employee has worked on this project within the timeframe that was selected.•Total Hours (digits)- Shows Total Hours but in decimal form. 
- (Optional) Clicking theNot Booked Employeestab will show all employees who don't have time worked within the timeframe that was selected. This will include the Employee Name and Employee ID.

data.title: How Do I Set Project To Be A Prevailing Wage Project?
data.description: This article will show you how to set a project as a prevailing wage project.
data.body:
Some projects require prevailing wage, and FieldFlō makes tracking those projects easy! This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to set a project as a prevailing wage project. 

# Required
 In order to indicate a prevailing wage project, you must have the Edit/Delete Projects role enabled . 

# Here are the steps to set project as a prevailing wage project:

- On your left main menu, clickProjects. 
- You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Once you find your project, click anywhere on theProject. 
- ClickProject Details. 
- Scroll down and click thePayroll Informationtab. 
- ClickIs this Job a Prevailing Wage Jobdrop-down and selectYes,then clickSave. Check out the following articles for more information on using FieldFlō's Prevailing Wage feature! 

 How Do I Add Prevailing Wage / CP Classification Types How Do I Add Prevailing Wage / CP Classification Groups How Do I Limit Prevailing Wages To Choose From On A Timesheet

data.title: How Can I View Specific Forms Used In The Last 60 Days?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how you can see any specific  forms used within the last 60 days.
data.body:
Viewing any form that has been used in the last 60 days is simple in FieldFlō. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Here are the steps to view forms completed in the last 60 days:

- On your left main menu, clickDashboard. 
- Once you're in the Dashboard, click theProjectstab. 
- Scroll down until you see theFormswidget. 
- Select theSettingsgear on the top right of the widget. 
- The Forms Filter selections will appear:Available Forms- Allows you to pick specific forms that you want to see.Intervals- Allows you to narrow down your search results by time frame ofLast 7 days,Last Month,Last 3 Months, orLast 6 Months.Form Status- Allows you to filter forOpenorClosedforms.Project Status- Allows you to see forms fromActiveorClosedprojects. 
- Once you have selected your desired filters, clickApply. 
- The widget will refresh and will show you all of the forms based on your filtering.Note:You can click on the blue text of any form to be taken directly to the form.

data.title: How Can I Select A Position For All Employees At Once On A Timesheet
data.description: This article will show you how you can easily select one position for all employees at once on a timesheet.
data.body:
Selecting a position to be assigned to all employees at once on a timesheet is easy with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

 In order to fill out a Daily Timesheet, you must have the Add/Edit Open Forms enabled.

data.title: How Do I Limit The Prevailing Wages  Types Available To Choose On A Timesheet?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to limit prevailing wage types to choose from on a project's timesheet.
data.body:
Limiting Prevailing Wage Types on a Project will help your employees select the correct Prevailing Wage Type on their projects. This article will show you the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 " Enable Prevailing Wage on Timesheet " setting under Company Module must be turned on in order to track Prevailing Wage Types on your Timesheets. 

 Prevailing Wage Types must be set-up in Portal Admins to use this feature. 

 In order to limit the Prevailing Wage Types available on a project's timesheet, you must have the Edit/Delete Projects permission. 

# Here are the steps to limit the Prevailing Wage Type selections on a timesheet:

- On your left main menu, clickProjects. 
- You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Once you find your project, click anywhere on theProject. 
- Once your project opens up, clickProject Details. 
- Click theTimesheet/Prevailing Wagetab. 
- Select theRadiobuttons next to each needed Prevailing Wage, or you can select a Prevailing Wage Group from theDrop-down. 
- Once all needed options are selected, clickSave. 
- Now what you've selected will be the only Prevailing Wages to choose from within this project's timesheet!

data.title: How Do I Remove "Trainings Needed" From An Employees Profile
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to remove "Trainings Needed" from an employees profile.
data.body:
Removing needed trainings from an employees profile is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to remove needed trainings from an employees profile, you must have the Edit Trainings role enabled. 

# Here are the steps on how to remove "Trainings Needed" from an employees profile:

- On your left main menu, clickCertificationthen clickTrainings. 
- Navigate to the specific training that you're looking for, you can use theSearchtool to easily find your training. 
- Once you've found the training, click the3 Dotsnext to the training name then clickEnroll/Enrolled. 
- Select theRadiobutton next to the needed employee(s), then clickRemove Employee 
- The PLEASE CONFIRM pop-up will appear, clickYes.
