data.title: How Do I Merge A Lead With An Existing Project
data.description: This article will show you how to merge a lead with an existing project.
data.body:
Merging a lead with a project is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to merge a lead with a project you must have these following roles enabled: 

- View All Projects or View Assigned Projects 
- Add Projects 
- View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads 
- Can Add Leads 

# Here are the steps to merge a lead with an existing project:

- On your left main menu, clickCRMthen clickLeads. 
- You can scroll to find your Lead, use the search bar, or click+ Filterfor more filtering options. 
- Once you've found your Lead, click on theLeadto open it up. 
- Once your lead opens up, click theAward & Create Projecttab. 
- Make sure the AwardRadiobutton is selected and clickSave. 
- SelectCreate Project. 
- Select the Merge with existing projectRadiobutton and select the project from theSelect Projectdrop-down. 
- Select one of theRadiobuttons under each of these fields.Note: These selections will determine what information will be on this newly merged project, you can select either the leads data or the projects data. 
- Once all selections are complete, clickSubmit. 
- Now this lead is merged with this project, you can jump straight to this project by clicking this Project link!

data.title: How Do I Use The Gantt Chart
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to use the Gantt Chart.
data.body:
Using FieldFlō's Gantt Chart is simple, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to use the Gantt Chart, you must have the Scheduling Reports role enabled. 

# Information
 FieldFlō's Gantt Chart is used for viewing all scheduled projects. This will give you a weekly calendar view for each project, showing employees and assets that are scheduled for each job. 

# Here are the steps to use the Gantt Chart:

- On your left main menu, clickSchedulingthen clickGantt Chart. 
- Click theWeekdrop-down and select which week you need to view. 
- (Optional) Select theRadiobutton next to Scheduled Projects Only to include only scheduled projects. If you want to include projects that aren't scheduled, make thisRadiobutton unchecked. 
- (Optional) Select the Show crew namesRadiobutton to include all scheduled employee names. If you don't want to include employee names, make thisRadiobutton unchecked. 
- When all required fields are entered, clickRun Report. 
- (Optional) Once the Gantt Chart opens, you can use theBlue Arrowsto toggle from one week to another. You also have theFilterdrop-down where you can choose which projects you would like to view. 
- (Optional) You can also click the3 DotsthenExport PDFto export this Gantt Chart.

data.title: How Do I Run A Schedule Report
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to run a schedule report.
data.body:
Running a schedule report is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to run a schedule report, you must have the Scheduling Reports role enabled. 

# Here are the steps to run a schedule report:

- On your left main menu, clickSchedulingthen clickReports. 
- Click theReportdrop-down and choose the following scheduling reporttypes:Project Schedules -This will group the report by project.Employee Schedules -This will group the report by employee.Asset Schedules -This will group the report by asset.Daily Scheduling Report -This will group the schedule by a single day 
- Select theWeekdrop-down and select the week this report is for.Note: If Daily Scheduling Report is selected, choose a date from theDatedrop-down and choose an option from theTypedrop-down. 
- Once all required fields are entered, clickRun Report. 
- You can now view this report. If you need to export this report, clickGenerate Report.

data.title: How Do I Order Inventory To A Project
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of how to order inventory to your project.
data.body:
Ordering items from the warehouse is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to fill out a warehouse request form, you must have the Add/Edit Open Forms role enabled. 

# Here are the steps to order inventory to a project:

- On the left side main menu, clickProjects. 
- You can scroll down to find yourProject. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Click on yourProject. 
- Scroll down and click the blue+ Add Formbutton. 
- Find theWarehouse Request Formand select theRadiobutton next to the form. 
- Once you have the form selected, clickSave. 
- Click on theWarehouse Request Form. 
- Click on theRequest Typedropdown and selectOrder, then clickNext. 
- SelectRequest By Nameand select your name, then enter thePinto verify. 
- Enter theDate Requested By.Note- This is the day you want the items delivered by. 
- Click+ Item. 
- Enter theItem Nameand any other details you need. 
- To add more items, click the+ Itemfor each item. 
- Once you have all your items added and are ready to submit, selectSubmit Request.Note- If you would like to come back to this Form and submit it later, you can selectSave & Close.

data.title: How Do I Use The Certificate Maker
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to use the certificate maker.
data.body:
Using FieldFlō's certificate maker is simple, this article will show you the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to utilize the certificate maker, you just have the Edit Certs role enabled. 

# Here are the steps on how to use the certificate maker:

- On your left main menu, clickCertificationthen clickCertificate Maker. 
- Complete each of the following mandatory fields, marked with a red * :Destination- This is where the certificate will appear after generation.Certificate Name- Choose the certificate name that you need generated.Training Name- Enter the training name that is associated with this certificate.Valid From- Choose the start date of this certificate.Expire- Choose the date of expiration for this certificate, if no expiration is needed click theNo Expiration Dateradio button.Certificate Author -Choose who is creating this certificate and enter the pin verification.Signature- Whoever is creating this certificate has to enter their signature, this will display on the certificate image. 
- Select theRadiobuttons next to each employee that needs this certificate.Note: You can search for employees using theNamesearch field, you can also narrow down your options by choosing aStatusto filter by. 
- Once all needed employees are selected, on the top right of your screen clickGenerate Certificates.

data.title: How Do I Add/Edit Warehouse Request Templates
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add and edit  warehouse request templates
data.body:
Adding and editing warehouse request templates is simple with FieldFlō, this article will show you the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to add and edit warehouse request templates, you must have Super Admin access. 

# Information
 Request templates are used for requesting items fast, you can add items to the template that are commonly ordered for that certain type of project. 

 When a project needs an initial inventory order, you can simply choose a template that will add needed inventory items to that order. You can always add or remove certain items per order if needed. 

# Here are the steps to add a warehouse request template:

- On your left main menu, clickAdminthen clickPortal Admins. 
- Scroll down to inventory and clickRequest Template. 
- Click+ Add Request Template. 
- Enter the mandatoryNamefor this template. 
- Enter eachItem, theQuantity, and any comments that may be needed for that item. 
- To add more items, clickadd new item. 
- Once all items are added, clickSave. 

# Here are the steps to edit an existing warehouse request template:

- Click the3 dotsnext to the needed template, then clickEdit. 
- The Edit Request Template pop-out will appear, you can edit any information in these fields. 
- Once all changes are made, clickSave.

 In order to complete a Respirator Fit Test, you must have the View All Projects or View Assigned Projects role enabled and the Add/Edit Open Forms role enabled.

- Use the search field or scroll to select theRadio Buttonnext to the Respirator Fit Test, then clickSave. 
- Click on theRespirator Fit Testform. 
- Once you're in the form, select an option from the following drop-downs:SupervisorTest Date- Will auto populate the current date. If a different date is needed, you can select this drop-down and choose the new date.Employee -This is the employee who is receiving the test.Type of RespiratorSize 
- As you go through testing, select theRadio Buttonsfor Pass, Fail, or NA next to each type of test. 
- (Optional) You can enter any additional comments or even attach files to this form. 
- Click thePreformed Bydrop-down and choose who preformed this test, then enter theSignatureand theDate. 
- Have the employee enter theirSignature, then double check theDatedrop-down. 
- Lastly, clickSave.

data.title: How Do I Build And Email A Proposal?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to create and email a proposal with FieldFlō.
data.body:
Creating proposals and sending proposal emails is easy with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to build and email Proposals, you must have the following roles enabled: 

 • View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads 
 • Can Add Leads 

# Here are the steps to create a proposal:

- On your left main menu clickCRM,then clickLeads. 
- You can scroll to find your Lead, use the search bar, or click+ Filterfor more filtering options. 
- Click on theLeadto open it up. 
- Once you're in the Lead, clickProposals. 
- If there are no proposals listed, click theAdd Proposalblue button. 
- The Add Proposal pop-out will appear, select theProposal ForandCreate Newradio button. 
- ClickSave. 
- Once your proposal opens, you're able to drag and drop each data object to the center of the proposal to start building. For detailed instructions on how to use each data object, you can click the following articles:How Do I Use The Title & Breakline Data Objects While Building Proposals?How Do I Use The Paragraph Data Object While Building Proposals?How Do I Use The Paragraph Advanced Data Object While Building Proposals?How Do I Use The Graphic Data Object While Building Proposals?How Do I Use The Insert PDF Data Object While Building Proposals?How Do I Use The Signature Data Object While Building Proposals?How Do I Use The Bid - Line Item Data Object While Building Proposals?How Do I Use The Project Details Read Only Data Object While Building Proposals? 

# Here are the steps on how to email a proposal:

- Once you've found your Lead, click on theLeadto open it up. 
- Once you're in the Lead, clickProposals. 
- Once you have your proposal added, click the3 dotsnext to the proposal then clickEmail Proposal. 
- The Send Proposal pop-out will appear, enter/choose the following fields:(Optional)Email GroupAdd Email -Selecting individual emails that will receive the proposal.Template 
- Lastly, clickSend.

data.title: How Do I Add / Edit Haul Estimates On A Project?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add / edit hauler estimates in your projects job costing.
data.body:
Adding / editing haul estimates on a project is easy with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to add and edit haul estimates to your project, you must have the Job Costing Estimate and Can View Contract Values Dashboard roles enabled in your employee profile. 

# Information
 • After Haul Estimates are added, the actual costs of haulers for each project will be updated using our Waste Load Out form. 

 • You can view Haul Estimates compared to the Haul Actual cost by clicking Export Job Costing Estimates within a project. 

# Here are the steps to add haul estimates to a project:

- On your left main menu, clickProjects. 
- You can scroll down to find your project, or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Once you find your project, click anywhere on theProject. 
- Your project dashboard will open up. Next to Job Costing, clickView Details. 
- To add a new estimate, scroll down to the Haul Estimates and click+ Haul Estimate. 
- The Haul Estimate pop-up will appear, fill out all of the mandatory fields which are marked with a red *, and clickSave. 

# Here are the steps to edit an existing haul estimate:

- Under Haul Estimates, click thePencilicon next to the needed estimate. 
- The Haul Estimate pop-up will appear, here is where you can make any changes to this estimate and clickSave.

 Click here for more information about FieldFlō's Expense Form

data.title: How Do I Fill Out An Expense Form?
data.description: It is easy to fill out an Expense Form and this article will show you how to do it!
data.body:
# Important
 Expense Types must be setup in Portal Admins before the Expense Form can be used properly. 

 Click here for instructions on how to enter Expense Types 

# Here are the steps to fill out an Expense Form

- ClickProjectson your left main menu. 
- Use theSearchFields or+Filterto find and navigate to your Project. 
- Once you found your Project, click anywhere on the row to open it. 
- While on the Project's Dashboard click the blue+Add Formbutton. 
- Search the form list for theExpense Formand selectRadio Buttonjust to the left of the form name. 
- Scroll to the bottom and clickSave. 
- Click on theExpense Formin the Active Forms area. 
- Depending on what your company requires, enter the appropriate information in theSS (Social Security Number) / ID (Employee ID) & Employee Fields.TheDatefield is not editable and is set as the date the form was opened.NOTE: This is the From Date, it may be different than the Purchase Date. 
- Click the blue+Add Rowbutton. (Click the + Add Row as many times as needed for every expense that needs to be submitted) 
- After adding all the rows that you need, several fields will appear. Fill out all all applicable fields.NOTE:None of the Fields are required but fill in as much information as possible.Purchase Date -Date purchase was madeProject Type- Select from Dropdown or Add CustomCost Type- Select from Dropdown or Add CustomCost -Dollar amount of the ExpenseReimbursable -SelectYesorNoPurchase From -Vendor or Store name where purchase was madeReceipt # -Identification number on ReceiptDescription -Details about the Expense or Purchase 
- To attach Receipt images to the form, clickChoose Fileand select the Receipt image. File types accepted are .jpg, .jpeg, .png or .pdf file types. 
- When all Expense are entered, press the Save & Close button at the bottom of the form. 
- On the Project's Dashboard, click the file box icon to Close the form.NOTE:A form MUST be Closed for it to be included in Reports and Job Costing.

data.title: Is There a Way Set Employee PINs In Bulk?
data.description: Absolutely there is! This article will walk you through the steps on how to update PIN numbers for multiple employees at one time.
data.body:
It is easy to add or update employee PINs for multiple employees at one time by using FieldFlō's Import Tool. 

# Requirements
 NOTE: You must have Super Admin Permissions to use FieldFlō's Import Tool. 

# Information

- In FieldFlō, a PIN (Personal Identification Number) is a four digit code used by Employees to verify information pertaining to themselves. 
- PINs should be kept private and unique to each employee. 
- To download an Employee Template that contains your current Employee Details, select theEmployeeshyperlink from theExport Areasection of the Import Tool (step 2 below). 

# Here are the steps on how to use the Import Tool to add or update Employee PINs:

- ClickAdminon your left main menu. Then scroll down to and selectImports. 
- Select theEmployeeTemplate from theExportsection. 
- Add the 4 digit code to theSet PINcolumn (Column Q) andSavethe file on your computer.Pro Tip: Apply a filter to the top row of the export file and filter the PIN column (Column P) by Yes or No. 
- When you are ready to import your updated template, selectEmployeesfrom the "Select Area for Import" drop-down menu, choose your file, and selectImport. 
- Check Log for Errors. 
- Correct any Errors on your Template andrepeat Step 3. 

# Additional Information
 If updating other Employee Details keep the following in mind: 

- All dates should be typed in format with 4 numbers for year. YYYY-mm-dd or mm/dd/YYYY or d.m.YYYY etc. (ie. 2020-10-30 or 10/30/2020 or 30.10.2020 etc.) 
- If you don't see any results following import then it means too many errors were found in your file. Please ensure you follow the template formats and have ID's listed for every item. 
- First and Last Name and Employee ID's are required fields. If employee with entered employee ID exists in database, it will be updated, otherwise it will be inserted as new. 
- Super admin, can login, active, US citizen, and temp labor fields will be set to "no" if not set to "yes". 
- Be aware that dates can be uploaded incorrectly depending on your excel file configuration, so please check Birth Date and Date Hired after import.

data.title: How Do I Run A Change Order Report
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to run a change order report.
data.body:
Running a change order report is made easy with FieldFlō, this article will show you exactly how to do this! 

# Requirement
 In order to run a change order report you must have Super Admin access. 

# Here are the steps to run a change order report:

- On your left main menu, clickAdmin. 
- The admin options will drop down, clickReporting Center. 
- Under the General Reports, clickChange Order Report. 
- Select your Time period by selecting/unselecting theEntire ProjectRadio button. If unselected complete theDate FromandDate Todrop-downs to choose the timeframe. 
- Choose which Work Order Types you would like to include by selecting/unselecting Radio buttons next to theWork Order Type. 
- Choose which project Change Order Status's you need to include by selecting/unselecting Radio buttons next to theChange Order Status. 
- Select which Projects you need to include in the report, click the Radio buttons next to eachProjectyou need included. You can use the Search field to find individual projects. 
- ClickRun Report. 
- Now you can see all Change Order data. 
- (Optional) You can access and edit any of the Change Order Internal Notes by clicking theEdithyperlink. 
- (Optional) The notes pop-up will appear, if you edit the notes be sure to clickSave. 
- (Optional) You can go straight to the individual Change Order Form by clicking theLink To Formhyperlink. 
- (Optional) You can export this report by clicking theDownload CSVblue button.

data.title: How Do I Run An Incident Report
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of running an incident report.
data.body:
Running an incident report is made easy with FieldFlō, this article will show you exactly how to do this! 

# Requirement
 In order to run an incident report, you must have Super Admin access. 

# Here are the steps to run an incident report:

- On the top right menu, click theReporting Centericon. 
- Under Safety Reports, clickIncident Report. 
- First select the Time Period by selecting the Radio buttons next to either of the following:All TimeThis YearLast YearCustom RangeIf this option is selected, enter yourDate FromandDate Toin the drop-downs 
- Select the type of Incident Category/Type by selecting the Radio buttons next to the following:AllIncidentsIf this option is selected, select/unselect the Radio buttons next to the Incidents Types that you need to include.Near MissIf this option is selected, select/unselect the Radio buttons next to the Near Miss Types that you need to include.Stop workIf this option is selected, select/unselect the Radio buttons next to the Stop Work Types that you need to include. 
- Select which Projects you need to include, you can select the Radio buttons next toAll ProjectsorCustomize.Note:If you pick Customize, select/unselect radio buttons next to the projects you need to include. 
- Once all of these steps are complete, click the blueGenerate Reportbutton. 
- The Generating Report pop-up will appear. Click eitherReturn to Export PageorLeave and be Notified,whichever you prefer.

data.title: How Do I Restore A Deleted Form

data.body:

- On your left main menu, clickProjects. 
- You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Once you find your project, click anywhere on theProject.

- Click theActive Formstab, you can now work on your restored form.

data.title: What Is The Expense Form Used For?
data.description: This article lists some of the ways the FieldFlō Expense form can be used.
data.body:
# Definitions
 Expense Form : A FieldFlō Stock Form used for recording and submitting costs, that may be reimbursable to an employee or for receipt tracking. 

# Information
 Costs entered on the Expense Form are included in the Project's Job Costing. 

# Expense Form Uses

- FieldFlō's Expense Form can be used to track project expenses associated with Parking, Hotels, Fuel, Materials, etc. 
- It can also be used to request reimbursement for a Vehicle or Phone allowance. 
- Entering and keeping receipts needed for Credit Card reconciliations is another great use of the Expense Form. 

# Important
 Expense Types must be set up in Portal Admins before the Expense Form can be used properly. 

 Click Here for Instructions on How to Enter Expense Types 

# Additional Resources
 The following articles contain additional helpful information associated with the Expense Form. 

 Click Here for Instructions on How to Fill out an Expense Form Click Here for Instructions on How to Approve Expenses Click Here for Instructions on How to Run an Expense Report

data.title: How Do I Access The FieldFlo Safety Academy
data.description: This article will walk you through how to access the FieldFlo Safety Academy
data.body:
The FieldFlo Safety Academy is a library full Safety Topics and can be used as Toolbox Talks for your Employees. This library has videos, documentation, and quizzes that can all be used as needed by you. This article will walk you through how to access it. 

# Information
 If you are not seeing the FieldFlo Safety Academy, you may need to reach out to Customer Success via email: support@fieldflo.com and have this turned on for you portal. 

# Here are the steps to accessing the FieldFlo Safety Academy:

- On the left hand side of your screen, clickCertificationand thenTrainings. 
- Once you are on the Trainings page, you will see a few filters:Only Activedropdown - This allows you to Filter the Trainings by their status.All Sourcesdropdown - There are several "Sources" under this dropdown:All Sources- Gives you a view of trainings from all sources.My Trainings- This gives you a view to only see trainings that your company has created.Stock Trainings- This gives you a view of FieldFlo Created Trainings.Safety Academy- This gives you a View of all the FieldFlo Safety Academy Videos.You can also Search for Trainings in the quick searchSearch Trainingsfield. 
- All of the FieldFlo Safety Academy Trainings will live under the Safety Academy filter and are defaulted to Inactive. 
- You will need toActivateany of the Trainings you would like to use by:Finding the video and clicking on theThree Little Dotson the far right side of the video.After the Admin Menu for the Training appears, click onEdit.You will be taken to the specific Training's edit page.Click onCertify.Select yourself in theNamedropdown and enter your PIN.Click on theClick to Enter Signature.TheEnter Your Signaturepopup will appear and you can add your signature.Once you have added you signature, clickOK.ClickYesunderTraining Active.ClickSave & Close. 
- The Training will now be available to deploy to all of your employees or select employees.

data.title: How Do I Add/Edit Stop Work Types For Projects?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to add and edit a stop work type for your project forms.
data.body:
Adding and editing a stop work type is simple within FieldFlo, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this. 

# Here are the steps for adding a stop work type:

- On your left main menu, clickAdmin. 
- The admin dropdown will appear, clickPortal Admins. 
- Scroll down to the safety section, clickSTOP WORK. 
- To add a new stop work type, click the blue button+ Add Stop Work Type. 
- Click theActiveradio button if you want this stop work type active immediately. 
- Enter theNameof the stop work type. 
- Select aPositionfrom the position dropdown.Note:The position is determining the order of your stop work type, selecting "Latest" will put your new stop work type on the bottom of the list while selecting "1" will make it on the top of your list. 
- When you've filled out all desired fields, clickSave. 

# Here are the steps to edit a stop work type:

- On your left main menu, clickAdmin. 
- The admin dropdown will appear, clickPortal Admins. 
- Scroll down to the safety section, clickSTOP WORK. 
- Find your stop work type that you need to edit. You can scroll to find your stop work type, you can search by theNamein the search bar or filter your options byStatus. 
- Once you find your desired stop work type, click the3 Dotsto the right of the stop work name. 
- The3 Dotsdropdown will appear, clickEdit. 
- You can now change theStatus, NameandPositionof the stop work type.Note:The position is determining the order of your stop work type, selecting "Latest" will put your new stop work type on the bottom of the list while selecting "1" will make it on the top of your list.The following stop work types are preset by FieldFlo and the names cannot be changed, only the position can be changed:InjuryFirst AidProperty DamageSpillVehicle AccidentEquipment FailureFireOther 
- Once all changes are made, clickSave.

data.title: Phone Version - How Do I Use “Same As Previous Day” For A Daily Timesheet?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of using the "Same As Previous Day" selection to fill out your daily timesheet on a phone.
data.body:
Starting a daily timesheet using the "Same As Previous Day" selection is easy with FieldFlo, this article will show you exactly how to do that! 

# Here are the steps for using the "Same As Previous Day" option to start your daily timesheet on your phone:

- On the top right, clickthree three lines 
- One the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click theProjectsmodule. 
- You can scroll down to find your project or click on the blue+ Filterbutton to search byProject Name,Project Numberor any of the other fields you would like to search by. 
- Once you found your project, click anywhere on the project to open up the details. 
- Once you're in the project, scroll down and clicktheblueStart Daybutton to access your company's mandatory forms. This will include the daily timesheet. 
- You will see all the mandatory forms, click theDaily Timesheet. 
- On the top right, click thethree little dots. 
- The admin pop out will appear, selectSame As Previous Day. 
- The SAME AS PREVIOUS pop out will appear, first click theSelect origin formdropdown and choose which daily timesheet's information you need to copy from.Note:Copying information from a previous timesheet will delete all entered items on the current timesheet 
- Select theCopy Assetsbubble if you have assets on the previous timesheet that you need to copy to your current timesheet. 
- ClickSubmit. 
- Now you will see all the employees, their phase, and position type was copied over from your previous timesheet to this current timesheet.

data.title: How Do I Return Items To The Warehouse
data.description: This article will go through the steps of returning your items back to your warehouse.
data.body:
Returning items to your warehouse is easy with FieldFlo, this article will show you exactly how to do that. 

# Here are the steps to returning items.

- On the left side main menu, clickProjects. 
- You can scroll down to find yourProject. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Click on yourProject.

- Once you have all your items added and are ready to submit, selectSubmit Request.Note- If you would like to come back to this Form and submit it later, you can selectSave & Close.

data.title: How Do I Use Daily Scheduling?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to schedule employees/assets for a single day using FieldFlō's Daily Scheduling feature.
data.body:
Creating and sending a schedule for a single day is easy with FieldFlo, this article will show you exactly how to do this! 

# Required
 In order to use the Scheduling module, you must have the Full Scheduling Access role enabled. 

# Here are the steps to send the schedule for a single day :

- On the left side main menu, select theSchedulingmodule. 
- TheSchedulingdropdown will appear, clickWeek. 
- Select theWeekyou need toSchedulefor and clickOpen. 
- Click theSet Daydropdown and select which specific day you need toSchedulefor.Note:This will change the interface to show hours instead of days. 
- Select theCrewtab. 
- Once you're in the crew view, you can use the buttons in the guide below to interact with the schedule:- Click this icon to moveforwardone hour.- Click this icon to movebackone hour.- Click this icon to moveforward.- Click this icon to moveback8 hours.Note:To return to the Week view, selectAllfrom the Set Day drop-down. 
- Find the employee or asset you need to schedule by scrolling, or you can use theEmployee FiltersorAsset Filterson the right hand side to quickly search and narrow down your list.Note:To clear filters for a fresh start, remove theEmployee/Asset Filtersradio button.Example: 
- Schedule hours by clicking on the employee/asset's row. You can schedule multiple hours at once by clicking and dragging across multiple hours.30 Minute Schedule Example:Drag FunctionExample: 
- After selecting hours, you have the following options to choose from and clickNext:•Schedule New Project- You can select this option to generate a brand new project directly from this screen.•Schedule Existing Project- Select this option to schedule a project that is already entered in FieldFlo.•Add Placeholder- Select this option to schedule an employee for a placeholder project.Note:If theSchedule Existing Projectoption is used, you can link this employee's schedule to an asset by selecting the assets radio button underneath the "Do you also want to schedule:"section. To learn how to link assets to an employee, click the button below!How Do I Link Assets To An Employee For Scheduling? 
- After clickingNext, configure the following options and clickSave:•Start Time- SetHrs,Mins, andAM/PMfor the start time by selecting options from the drop-down.•End Time- SetHrs,Mins, andAM/PMfor the end time by selecting options from the drop-down.•Break- Enter the employees break by selecting an option from the drop-down.- SelectScheduling Notesto enter any notes you'd like the employees to see in their scheduling confirmation text.- If a placeholder is being set up, selectPlaceholder Titleand add the name of your place holder.•Employee Notes- If employees enter notes in their confirmation text for this day, they will appear here. ClickClear Notificationsto acknowledge and clear the alert. ClickClearto permanently delete the note. 
- (Optional) After configuring hours, you have the follow icons to adjust time:- This icon copies the selected hours to another employee or asset.- This icon moves the selected employee(s)/asset(s) hours to a different project.- If one day's hours is selected, you can click this icon to copy those hours to another day.- This icon deletes the selected hours.Note: To use these icons,you must select which employees or assets hours will be effected by making sure theirHoursare clicked and highlighted green.These icons will only effect the hours that are selected.Example: 
- (Optional) You can send a confirmation text to employees individually by selecting theRadiobuttons next to their name, and click theicon.Note: While using theicon, a text will send to all employees that are selected.Example: 
- (Optional) You can send a confirmation text to all employees who are scheduled by clickingReady SMS, Send Schedule, then clickYes.Note:ClickingReady SMSwill send a text toALL EMPLOYEESwho are scheduled acrossALL PROJECTS. 
- Ifis selected, theSend Scheduleconfirmation will appear, make sure theRadiobutton is selected next to the day you're sendingSchedulefor and clickYes.

data.title: How Do I Set Up OSHA Establishments? (Multi-Office Portals Only)
data.description: This article will explain what OSHA Establishment Groups are and how to create them to use for OSHA 300 Log Reporting in FieldFlō.
data.body:
It is very easy to create Establishment Groups in FieldFlō. Establishments are used when running OSHA 300 Logs. You can create Establishments to combine information from your different Branch Offices or Locations. 

# Requirements
 NOTE: Only Multi-Office FieldFlō Portals have the mini admin for OSHA reporting. 

- You must be a Super Admin to access OSHA Reporting. 

# Information
 OSHA Establishment: In the context of OSHA 300 log reporting, an establishment is the unit for which an employer must maintain records of work-related injuries and illnesses. 

 In FieldFlō you can create Establishments by grouping your "Offices" together. 

# Here are the steps to setting up OSHA Establishments:

- On your left main menu clickAdmin 
- SelectPortal Admins. 
- Scroll down to theSafetysection and selectOSHA Establishment Groups. 
- Click thebutton at the top right of the screen. 
- Name yourEstablishment Group. 
- SelectOffices/Branchesto include in the Establishment Group. 
- Enter anAddressto show on your OSHA 300 Logs. 
- Enter aSICorNICS Code. 
- Enter anIndustry Description. 
- EnterDART,ITIR, andLTIRvalues. 
- ClickSave.

data.title: How Do I Associate A Certificate With A Skill?
data.description: This article will cover how to associate Certifications with an Employee's designated Skill in FieldFlo.
data.body:
Setting needed Certifications for a Skill is simple with FieldFlō. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this! 

# Information
 • What is a Skill? - You can associate Skills to Employees to keep track of what tasks that employee is capable of doing. You can make Skills anything that makes the most sense for the type of work that your company performs. Skills are useful to dispatchers in the Scheduling Module because you can filter Employees by their "Skills." 

 • Skill Examples: Burner, Operator, Flagger, Saw Cutter, Company Approved Driver, Badgeable, etc. 

 • Why Associate a Certificate with a Skill? Associating a certificate with a Skill will allow you to compare which Certifications the Employee has, to which Certifications a selected Skill requires. You can view this information within the Employee's profile under the Employee Certs tab. 

# Here are the steps to set needed certifications for a skill:

- On your left main menu, clickAdminthenPortal Admins. 
- Scroll down to the EMPLOYEE section and clickSKILLS. 
- Click on theSkillthat you need to set certifications for. 
- Now select theRadiobuttons next to each needed certificate for that Skill. You can use the search field to find specific Certifications. 
- Once all certificates are selected, clickSave. 
- Within an Employee's profile under theEmployee Certstab, if you select aSkillfrom theSkill Previewdrop-down you can see which certificates the employee has compared to which certificates the Skill requires. 

# Note:
 You can select the Need radio button to save what certificates the employee needs. This prevents you from having to check each Skill every time you want to verify if an employee has the certificates they need.

data.title: How Can I Update Emergency Details For Multiple Employees At One Time?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to update emergency details for multiple employees at one time.
data.body:
It is easy to add and update emergency details for multiple employees at one time by using FieldFlō's Import Tool. 

# Requirements
 NOTE: You must have Super Admin Permissions to use FieldFlō's Import Tool. 

# Information

- To download an Employee Template that contains your current Employee Details, select theEmployeeshyperlink from theExport Areasection of the Import Tool. 

# Here are the steps on how to use the Import Tool to add and edit Employee Details:

- ClickAdminon your left main menu. Then scroll down to and selectImports. 
- Select theEmployeeTemplate from theExportsection. 
- When you are ready to import your updated template, selectEmployeesfrom the "Select Area for Import" drop-down menu, choose your file, and selectImport. 
- Check Log for Errors. 
- Correct any Errors on your Template andrepeat Step 3. 

# Additional Information
 If updating other Employee Details keep the following in mind: 

- All dates should be typed in format with 4 numbers for year. YYYY-mm-dd or mm/dd/YYYY or d.m.YYYY etc. (ie. 2020-10-30 or 10/30/2020 or 30.10.2020 etc.) 
- If you don't see any results following import then it means too many errors were found in your file. Please ensure you follow the template formats and have ID's listed for every item. 
- First and Last Name and Employee ID's are required fields. If employee with entered employee ID exists in database, it will be updated, otherwise it will be inserted as new. 
- Super admin, can login, active, US citizen, and temp labor fields will be set to "no" if not set to "yes". 
- Be aware that dates can be uploaded incorrectly depending on your excel file configuration, so please check Birth Date and Date Hired after import.# If you need assistance please emailSupport@FieldFlo.com.

data.title: How Do I Edit Start and End Times On A Timesheet?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to change Start and End times on a Timesheet.
data.body:
It's easy to change the Start and Stop times on a Timesheet if you have the permissions to do so. 

# Requirements
 NOTE : You must have the Can Edit Time permission to change Start and End times on a Timesheet. 

# Information
 TIP: If the work day is not complete, only change your Start Time. 

- Entering an End Time before the day is over, will stop your clock and cause your project to no longer show on the Today's Projects widget. 
- To change only a Start Time, select the "Don't Change End Date and Time" radio button before clickingSubmit. 

# Here are the steps to changing Start and End Times on a Timesheet:

- While in a Timesheet, select theradio buttonsfor the Employee(s) you would like to adjust the times for. 
- Select theicon. 
- The “Change Time For Selected” window will appear. Edit Start Time, End Time, and Break Time. 
- Once you have made your changes, enter yourPINnumber and clickSubmitto update the times for all selected employees.

data.title: How Do I Use The Timesheet Adjuster?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to use the Timesheet Adjuster tool in FieldFlō.
data.body:
The Timesheet Adjuster is an efficient tool in the FieldFlo system, used to enter hours worked in the event that a timesheet was never created, the day has already passed, or if an employee was never added to the timesheet. It is particularly useful for changing dates on timesheets when direct date modification is not supported. 

# Requirements
 NOTE: You must have the Timesheet Adjuster permission to access the Timesheet Adjuster tool. 
 Additionally, some timesheet settings, such as enabling advanced features or using the Timesheet Adjuster, require specific permissions and should be verified with your system administrator. 

# Information
 There are 3 different ways to access the Timesheet Adjuster: 

- # Admin Module:SelectAdminon your left main menu.From the Admin sub-menu, selectTimesheet Adjuster. 
- # Project's Dashboard:Navigate to the Project.Select theat the top right of the Project's Dashboard.SelectTimesheet Adjuster. 
- # Timesheet:Navigate to the Project and Open a Timesheet.Select theat the top right of the Timesheet.Select theTimesheet Adjusterfrom the drop-down menu. 

# Here are the steps on how to add or edit hours with the Timesheet Adjuster:

- Navigate to the Timesheet Adjuster from the Admin Module, Project's Dashboard, or Timesheet. 
- Choose a project from the drop-down menu. 
- Select the date that you would like to adjust the timesheet for. 
- Select the radio buttons next to the name(s) of the employees you need to adjust hours for. 
- Scroll down to the next section. 
- Select Radio Buttons for Billable, Breaks taken, Injuries, and enter Notes, as needed. 
- Enter total work time in hours and minutes. 
- Select the Primary Position and Primary Phase (if applicable). You can add morepositions if relevant, by clicking on+ Add Position. 
- Select theSavebutton to confirm your adjustments. Note: The Timesheet Adjuster is best suited for making changes to past dates, as it cannot modify dates directly. 

# Information
 NOTE: If adjusting hours for an employee who is already on the Timesheet, enter total hours worked. The Timesheet Adjuster will overwrite the original Timesheet hours. 

 Troubleshooting: If unable to change a timesheet date, recreate the timesheet using the Timesheet Adjuster and delete the incorrect one.

data.title: How Do I Create A Reach-out In The CRM?
data.description: This article will teach you how to track your CRM reach-outs to clients.
data.body:
Logging your CRM client reachouts has never been easier and you can do so in just a few simple steps. 

# Required
 You must have the roles under CRM to view Leads or View Only Assigned Leads. 

# Information
 Note: CRM Reachouts are logged by client under CRM - Clients 
 You can set up a Daily Notification for CRM Reachouts under the Gear Icon. 

# Here are the steps to setting up a Reachout:

- Click CRM on the left menu and Leads. 
- Filter to find the lead and click within Lead to open. 
- Under the Choose Client/s section, if a client is not listed, click Add Prospect Client. If a client is listed, go to step 5. 
- Once the Add Prospect Client window opens, you can pull from existing client by typing a min. of 3 characters in the Client field or Create New by filling in the required information. Save once client info is entered. 
- Click Setup and fill in required Reachout Information with User in the dropdown, date of Reachout, a reoccurrence if applicable and reason then Save. 
- Once the client has been contacted, you can repeat steps 1-3 and click Contacted with Notes and Save.

data.title: (IOS App ONLY) How Do I Edit a Form That Was Started Offline?
data.description: If your employee is using FieldFlo Offline App on their iOS device, you can now see that data in live time with internet connection.
data.body:
You can now see your teams Active Forms live with internet connection, allowing you to edit them in just a few steps. 

# Information
 Please remember you can only see Active forms on the Web URL in live time if your Supervisor/Foreman has internet connection. 

# How To Edit An Active Offline Form?

- Go toProjectson your left menu. 
- Filterto find the project needed andclickon any white space within the row. 
- Scroll down to your Active Forms and look for the Mobile App icon. 
- Click on the "Take Over" icon on the left side of the needed form. 
- The Take Over popup will appear. If you want to make all future edits in the web app click "Yes". If you still want edits to be completed on the mobile app click "No". 
- If you clicked yes, the Notification will appear that this Form has been converted to normal state. This means that going forward this form can only be edited on the Web Application. 
- Clickon the form to open and edit as needed.

data.title: How To Quick Transfer Equipment
data.description: This article will explain the steps on how to quickly transfer equipment in FieldFlo
data.body:
It is easy to transfer your equipment from job to job in FieldFlo, just follow these steps. 

# Requirements
 Note: In order to quickly transfer a piece of equipment you must allow the quick transfer option on the item you would like to transfer selected and the Asset Class must be set up as Equipment. 

# Information
 Note: You can only quick transfer equipment if the item is already checked out to a project. This will allow you to move the equipment from project to project. 

# Here are the steps on how to Quick Transfer equipment:

- Click on theInventoryModule on your left main menu. 2. Find the equipment you would like to transfer by using the filter/search engine. 

 3. Once you find the equipment you would like to transfer click the 3 dots located on the right side of the line item. 

 4. The menu for the equipment will open up and then you will click on the option: Quick Transfer 

 5. Once the pop-up window opens, you will be able to select the project the equipment is currently at, select the project you would like to transfer it to, and lastly, select the quantity you would like to transfer. Proceed to transfer by clicking on the red Transfer button. 

# Information
 Note: Using this tool it will create the warehouse request for you and automatically close it out. The equipment will no longer be in Project A but instead, it will be in Project B, and on the record for Project A it will show that it was returned.

data.title: How Can I Quickly Update Inventory Item Details for Multiple Items?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how update multiple inventory items at once using the Import Tool.
data.body:
It is easy to add and update multiple Inventory item details at one time by using FieldFlō's Import Tool. 

# Requirements
 NOTE: You must have Super Admin Permissions to use FieldFlō's Import Tool. 

# Information

- To download a blank Inventory Template, select the Inventory hyperlink from theAvailable Templatessection. 
- To download an Inventory Template that contains your current Inventory information select the Inventory hyperlink from theExport Areasection. 

# Here are the steps on how to use the Import Tool to add and edit Inventory Item Details:

- ClickAdminon your left main menu. Then scroll down to and selectImports. 
- Select an Inventory Template from either section. 
- When you are ready to import your updated template, selectInventoryfrom the "Select Area for Import" drop-down menu. 
- Check Log for Errors. 
- Correct any Errors on your Excel File andrepeat Step 3. 

# Additional Information

- All dates should be typed in format with 4 numbers for year. YYYY-mm-dd or mm/dd/YYYY or d.m.YYYY etc.(ie. 2020-10-30 or 10/30/2020 or 30.10.2020 etc.) 
- If evolution daily rate up to, evolution weekly rate up to and evolution reset logic after fields are set to 0, item will be set to use company setup. 
- If they are empty, value already in those fields will stay. 
- If you want to change evolution fields, be aware that you must set all 3 fields. If one field is missing that will be considered as bad formatting. 
- If you don't see any results following import, it means too many errors were found in your file. Please ensure you follow the template formats and have ID numbers listed for every item. 
- Item Name and item number are required fields. 
- If item with entered item number exists in database, it will be updated, otherwise it will be inserted as new. 
- Possible values forAsset Classare:Equipment, Heavy Equipment, Tool, Respirators, Materials, Rentals and Consumable. 
- If value is any other, asset class will be set toConsumable.# If you need assistance please emailSupport@FieldFlo.com.
