data.title: Can I Change The Amount Of Time To Be Alerted To Upcoming Certificate Expirations?
data.description: This article will show you how to change when you will be notified of upcoming Certificate expiration dates.
data.body:
You can absolutely adjust the amount of time to be alerted before a Certificate or License is set to expire. 

# Requirements
 Note: You must have access to the Certifications Module to change this setting. 

# Information
 This is a Global Setting that will effect all Certificates and Licenses. This alert cannot be customized per User, Employee, or Certificate. 

# Follow the steps below to change the number of days to be alerted of upcoming Certificate Expirations:

- On your left main menu, select theCertificationmodule. This will reveal more options: Certificates, Trainings, and Certificate Maker. SelectCertificates. 
- On the Certificates page, click thethree dotsat the top right of your screen. 
- SelectSettingsfrom the drop down menu. Enter thenumber of daysyou would like to be alerted before a certificate expires. PressSave.

data.title: How Do I Add a Task to the PSI/JHA Task Library?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to add Tasks, Hazards, and Controls to use on your PSI/JHA Forms.
data.body:
You can save your most commonly used Tasks, their associated Hazards, and the Controls used to minimize those Hazards in your FieldFlō Portal. Those Tasks, Hazards, and Controls can then be used on your PSI/JHA forms. 

# Requirements
 NOTE: You must have Super Admin Permissions to Add/Edit items in your Task Library. 

# Information
 The task library is held under the "Pre Job Task Management" section of the Project Module's three dots (portal admin). 

 We have preloaded a few Tasks on your portal as examples. You can edit or remove those tasks as needed. 

# Here are the steps to enter your Task, Hazards, and Controls:

- Select theProjectsmodule form your left main menu. 
- Click the3 dotsat the top right and selectPre Job Task Management. 
- Click the blue+ Add Taskbutton on the top right. 
- Enter yourTask, Hazard, Control,and select aRisk Rating. PressSave. 
- To edit a Task, Hazard, Control, or Risk Rating, simply click theTask Name. When the window slides out , make desired changes and press Save. 

# Additional Information
 Tasks, Hazards, and Controls can also be added to your library by following this path: Admin>Portal Admin> (PSI/JHA) Tasks

data.title: How Do I Edit My Personal Information?
data.description: This article will show you how to update your personal information.
data.body:
Updating your personal information in FieldFlo is easy, and this article will show you how to do it. 

# Information
 From your personal profile, you have the ability to update the following information: 

- First and Last name 
- Address 
- Phone number 
- Date of birth 
- PIN 
- Password 

# Here is how to edit your personal information in FieldFlo:

- From the FieldFlo Dashboard, select theMy Accountbubble in the bottom left corner 
- When you have finished updating your information, clickSavein the bottom right corner

data.title: How Do I Add Project Types?
data.description: This article will cover how to add Project Types in FieldFlo.
data.body:
Adding project types is easy, and this article will show you how to do it. 

# Requirements
 NOTE: You must be have access to the 'Projects' module. If you do not see the 'Projects' module, please contact your Company Guru for assistance. 

# Here are the steps to add project types:

- Select theProjectsmodule on the left-hand side. 
- Select thethree dotson the right-hand side, then selectProject Type Management. 
- Select+Add Project Type. 
- Nameyour project type, then clickSavewhen finished.

data.title: How Do I Create a Project?
data.description: This article will cover how to create a project.
data.body:
Creating a new project in FieldFlo is easy, and this article will show you how to do it. 

# Requirements
 You must have access to the 'Projects' module and the permissions to 'Add Projects'. Please contact your Company Guru if you are not able to add a project. 

# Information
 When creating a new project in FieldFlo, you have the ability to set up project templates that make this process quicker and easier. See the below article for a step by step process on creating project templates: 
 How Do I Create a Project Template? 

# Here are the steps to creating a project in FieldFlo:

- From the FieldFlo dashboard, select theProjectsmodule 
- Once you are in the Projects module, selectAdd Projectin the top right corner 
- Select aProject Templatefrom the drop-down menu, or selectNo Template - Use Default 
- Fill in necessary project informationRequired fields are marked with an asterisk * 
- Once you are finished, pressSaveat the bottom of the page

data.title: How Do I Create a Project Template?
data.description: This article will go over how to create project templates.
data.body:
It is easy to create project templates, and this article will show you how to do it. Project templates make adding new projects to FieldFlo quick and easy, by allowing the freedom to make items mandatory, not mandatory, visible or hidden. 

# Requirements
 You must have access to the admin module to create a project template. 

# Here are the steps to creating a project template in FieldFlo:

- Select theAdminmodule, then selectPortal Admins 
- SelectProject Templates 
- SelectAdd Project Detail Settings 
- Add in yourTemplate NameTo make an item mandatory, click onNot Mandatoryand the text will update toMandatoryTo make an item invisible, click onVisibleand the text will update toInvisible 
- When you have finished customizing your template, pressSaveat the bottom

data.title: How Do I Change My Company Guru?
data.description: This article will cover how to change your company guru.
data.body:
It is easy to change your company guru in FieldFlo, and we will show you how to do it step by step. 

# Requirements
 NOTE: In order to change your company guru, you must be a SuperAdmin. Only SuperAdmins will have access to the company module. 

# Here are the steps to changing your company guru:

- On the left hand side of your screen on the main menu, click onCompany. 
- Scroll down to the 'Company Guru'section andselectyour new guru from the drop-down menuYour new guru must have login access to be selected from the drop-down menu 
- Once you are finished, pressSavein the bottom right corner

data.title: How Do I Create a Scheduling Group?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to create Scheduling Groups.
data.body:
It is very easy to create a Group to use in the Scheduling Module within FieldFlō. 

# Requirements
 NOTE: You must have "Full Scheduling Access" permissions to create Groups in Scheduling. 

# Information
 Groups are used in the Scheduling Module to quickly Schedule multiple employees, who typically work together, to a project without having to select the employees individually. 

# Follow the steps below to create Scheduling Groups:

- SelectSchedulingon your left main menu. 
- Click onSettings. 
- At the top of the Scheduling Settings page click the three dots and selectScheduling Groups. 
- Click the blue button that says"+ Add Group". 
- Enter aGroup Name, select theEmployee's namesthat you want added to this Group, and pressSaveto create the Group. 
- You can Edit or Remove Groups by clicking the 3 dots adjacent to the Group name on the Scheduling Groups page.

data.title: How To Add Default Folder Structure To Projects
data.description: This article will walk you through how to add the default folder structure to a project.
data.body:
With just a few steps, you will be able to organize your project's documentation. 

# Here are the steps on how to add the default folder structure to projects:

- First find the project you would like to add the default folder structure. Click onProjects. 

 2. Search for your project by using the Filtering options. 

- Once you find the project click on it to go into it. 

 3. Proceed to click on the 3 dots located on the right side of your project dashboard to open up the project menu. 

- Click onDocuments. 

 4. In the document management section click on the 3 dots located on the right side of the screen 

- Click onCOPY DEFAULT FOLDER STRUCTURE. 

 NOTE: Your default folder structure will copy over, and you can now proceed to save any documentation pertaining to the project.

data.title: How To Set Up Default Folder Structure
data.description: This article will walk you through how to set up the Default Folder Structure.
data.body:
It is easy to create and customize your default folder structure; this will allow you to keep your project document vault organized. 

# Requirements
 NOTE: To be able to access and manage the default folder structure you must be a Super Admin user. 

# Information
 Creating a default folder structure will allow you to set up the folder structure across all projects with the same layout. 

 NOTE: These are empty folders that can then be added to each project to save documentation. 

 To learn how to add the default folder structure inside the project click on this link: 
 How To Add Default Folder Structure To My Project 

# Here are the steps to set up your default folder structure:

- Find the Company Module on your left main menu. Click onCompany. 

 2. Once inside the Company Module, click on the three dots located on the top right side of the screen. 

- From the pop-up menu click onDefault Folder Structure. 

 3. In the Default Folder Structure module you are able to add a new folder by clicking on the "Add New Folder" blue button. 

- You are also able toedit/deletethe existing folders by clicking on thePencilicon to edit or theTrashcanicon to delete.

data.title: How Do I Clear Schedule Notifications?
data.description: This article will show you how to remove a note or denied schedule notification.
data.body:
You can clear your Schedule Notifications from FieldFlo in just a few easy steps. 

# Requirements
 Note : The employee role of Full Scheduling Access must be enabled for this process. 

# Here are the steps to remove scheduling notifications:

- Click on theCalendarIcon at the top of your portal screen. 
- Click on theweekshowing the conflict. 
- Scroll to Crew and click on theNotepadon the employee to open the conflict. 
- On the open schedule, check Confirmation Status and/or Employee Notes for issue. 
- Adjust the employee per the note if applicable. 
- Click the radio bubble forClear Notificationsand clicksave. 
- If an adjustment has been made, click onCrew tab. 
- Click radio bubble besideemployeeand clicksend scheduleicon.

data.title: How Do I See A Report of Employee Certificates?
data.description: This article will tell you how to run a report of all employee certificates.
data.body:
You can pull a report of all of your employees certificates and their status in just a few quick steps. 

# Requirements
 Note : The employee roles of View Employees and View Certs must be enabled. 

# Here are the steps to run an employee certification report:

- ClickCertificationthenCertificateson the left menu. 
- ClickReporton the right side of the screen. 
- Click the option you want on how to be notified. 
- Once the report is done, open Excel File. 
- View your trainings in 2 different waysTraining Matrix: Show you a key for the different certs and their status.Certificate Summary: Allows you to filter by name, cert or date.

data.title: How Do I Download Certificates for All Employees?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to download certificates for all employees .
data.body:
This article will teach you how to download a lot of all employee certificates in just a few simple steps. 

# Requirements
 Note : You must have the roles of View Employees, Edit Certs and View Certs must be enabled in an employee to pull these certificates. 

# Information
 If you would like to learn how to pull certificates based on a Project and who worked on the Project, click the button below: 
 How Do I Pull Certificates on a Project Level? 

# Here are the steps to downloading inactive employee certificates:

- Click onCertificationthenCertificatesfrom the left menu.Note:Click on the+Filter buttonand change Status toInactive.Add any additional filters (Employees, Cert Names, etc) needed.Note: You can pull a max of 100 certifications at a time.Scroll to the bottom of the page and change to view 100 items. Then scroll back to the top and click the Select All radio button 
- Clickthe radio button next to the name(s) orclickthe button to the left of First Name to select all names/certificates on the page. 
- Clickthe 3 dots at the end of the status row thenselectdownload to pdf or zip. 
- You will need to repeat steps 5 & 6 for each page of items.

data.title: How Do I Use the CRM Approver Option for Proposals?
data.description: This article will show you how to set up the CRM Approver option for Proposals.
data.body:
FieldFlo allows you to decide who can approver your proposals inside of a Lead with just a few steps. 

# Requirements
 Note : Only a Super Admin is able to make the changes needed to set up the CRM Approver functionality for Proposals. 

# Information
 To learn how to set Employee Roles click here to see the steps. 

# Here are the steps to setting up a CRM Approver

- ClickCompanyand scroll to the Other section and clickCRM Proposal Approval Requiredandsave. 
- Set the employee role asCRM Approverandsave. 

# Here are the steps needed for the Approve Proposal

- Once your proposal is ready,clickthe 3 dots andApprove Proposal. 
- The CRM Approver will approve the proposal. 
- Once approved, you can email or mark as sent and proceed with the Proposal process.

data.title: How Do I Share A Project Level Document To An External Person?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to share a file or folder to someone outside of your organization for a specific project.
data.body:
FieldFlō now allows you the ability to share a public link to a specific file or folder, created by you, externally with just a few steps. 

# Requirements
 NOTE: You must have the employee role to Edit/Delete/Share Docs under the Document System 

# Information
 If you need to learn how to set an employee roles, you can do so under step four of this article: How Do I Give My Employee Login Access To FieldFlō . 

# Here are the steps to sharing a project level document:

- Navigate toProjectson the left menu 
- Searchby Project Name or Number to find your project andclickanywhere to open it 
- Clickon the 3 dots in the right corner and selectDocument 
- Findyour company created Folder or File (it will be grey),clickthe 3 dots at the end of the row and selectShare Public Link 
- Use the Dropdown toselectthe correct permission and clickCreate 
- The below message will appear on your screen, you canclickthe X to navigate out of that screen 
- You can now add the URL link to an email or message to send. 

# Information
 The above steps can be followed to copy the link again or unshare link. 

 Any files or folder that have been previously shared will show a link icon listed in the Shared/Gallery/Offline column.

data.title: How Do I Find a List Of My Clients?
data.description: This article will allow you to export a list of your clients for review and updating.
data.body:
You are able to export a list of your clients in a few easy steps. 

# Requirement
 Note : Only a Super Admin is able to access the import tool in FieldFlo. 

# Here are the steps to download a client list:

- ClickAdminthenImportson the left menu. 
- Under the Export Area clickClients. 
- This will populate an Excel sheet for download.

data.title: How Do I Create A Weekly Timesheet?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to create a Weekly Timesheet.
data.body:
Sometimes you need to create a Weekly Timesheet, and with FieldFlō, this is very easy to do! 

# Requirements
 Note: The user must have the Weekly Timesheet Role and Permission assigned to them in order for them to create a Weekly Timesheet. 

# Information
 Submitting a Weekly Timesheet will create a closed Daily Timesheet. You can find and edit this Daily Timesheet in the Closed Form section of that specific Project. 

# Important
 Note: After a Weekly Timesheets is Submitted, it can only be edited on the Daily Timesheet. Any edits to the Weekly Timesheet will not be reflected on Payroll Exports. 

# Here are the steps to creating a Weekly Timesheet

- On the left hand side of your screen, click on theAdminmodule and scroll down until you see Weekly Timesheet. 
- ClickWeekly Timesheet. 
- Select the Employee that this Weekly Timesheet is for in theEmployee Dropdownand select the Date from theDate Fromfield and click the blueStartbutton. 
- Click the blue+next to Projects 
- A pop up will appear called "Add Projects". Go through the list and select all the Projects that you would like on this Employee's Weekly Timesheet. 
- Once you have selected all of the Projects clickAdd. 
- Now you can select the day for each of the Projects that you need to add time to and once the following field(s) are filled out for each day and Project, you can click the blueSubmit Timesheetbutton:PositionStart TimeEnd TimeBreakOptional: If you need to split the time between two or more positions you can click on the blue + underneath the word "Note" and this will bring up an additional row to add the information. 
- After you click the blueSubmit Timesheet button, a pop up will appear called "Please Confirm". If everything is correct, clickYes.

data.title: How Do I Add More Than One Supervisor To A Project?
data.description: This article will walk you through adding more than one Supervisor to a project.
data.body:
Sometimes you need to have more than one supervisor assigned to a project and in FieldFlō, we have made this easy to do by following the steps below. 

# Requirements
 Note: In order to add additional Supervisors to a project, you must have the Edit/Delete Projects role enabled. 

# Information
 • Once Supervisors are added to a project, you can restrict their access and have them only be able to view project's that they are a Supervisor on. You can initiate this feature by changing their roles from View All Projects to View Assigned Projects . 

# Here are the steps to add more than one Supervisor to a project:

- On the left hand side of your screen click theProjectsmodule. 
- Find the project that you need to add an additional supervisor on and click on the project. 
- Find the hyperlink that saysProject Detailsand click onProject Details. 
- On the Projects Details page, scroll down and click on the tab that saysAssigned Personnel. 
- Once on the Assigned Personnel tab, click in theDropdownand select the employee or if you need to add more click+ Add Employee.Once you are done adding employees clickSave.

data.title: How Do I Export Project Photos
data.description: This article will walk you through exporting project photos.
data.body:
It is so easy to export project photos out of FieldFlō and this article will show you how! 

# Here are the steps to exporting project photos out of FieldFlō

- On the left hand side of your screen, Click on the Project module. 
- Once on the Projects page, find the project that you want and click on the Project. 
- Once inside the project click the 3 dots located on the top right side of the screen. 
- A dropdown will appear. Click oDocuments. 
- Once on the Documents page, click on the folder calledForm Images. 
- Find the pictures that you want to download and click theradiobutton next to each of the photos that you want. 
- Next click the3 dotslocated underneath "List View", then clickDownload.

data.title: How Do I Upload Company Documents
data.description: This article covers how to upload company documents.
data.body:
This article covers how to upload company documents that your company has into FieldFlō making them available to all projects. It is easy to do. Just follow the steps below. 

# Requirements
 Note: You must be setup as a super admin to upload Company Documents. 

# Information
 Remember all of these docs flow over into every project 

# Here are the steps to see Company Documents

- On the left hand side of your screen, click on the Company module in the main menu. 
- Once on the Company Page, click on the3 dotson the top right of your screen. 
- A dropdown will appear. Click onCompany Documents. 
- This will take you to the Company Documents page and you can click on+Add Folder(this will allow you to create a new folder) or click on+ Add Files(this will allow you to upload files).

data.title: How Do I See Company Documents
data.description: This article covers how to see company documents.
data.body:
This article covers how to see company documents that your company has uploaded into FieldFlō making them available to all projects. It is easy to do. Just follow the steps below. 

# Requirements
 Note: This only works for documents that have been uploaded in the Company Documents Library. If you want to learn "How To Upload Documents To The Company Library, click on this button below: 

 How Do I Upload Company Documents 

# Information
 Remember all of these docs flow over into every project. 

# Here are the steps to see Company Documents

- On the left hand side of your screen, click on the Company module in the main menu. 
- Once on the Company Page, click on the3 dotson the top right of your screen. 
- A dropdown will appear. Click onCompany Documents. 
- This will take you to the Company Documents page and you can click on any of the folders or documents to see them.

data.title: How Do I Require Employee Verification of Schedule?
data.description: This article will teach you how to require your employees to verify their schedules.
data.body:
Getting a confirmation of employee schedules has never been easier! With just a few steps, you can make sure that your employees know exactly where they need to be on a daily basis and have the employee verify that they are going to be there. 

# Requirements
 Note: You must have Full Scheduling Access enabled in your employee details to view the Scheduling module. 

- Click onSchedulingon the left menu and selectSettingsfrom the list. 
- On the Settings page, you will need to enable the radio button byConfirmation. 
- ClickSaveat the bottom of the page. NOTE: By enabling Confirmation, several things will now happen when the schedule is sent. 

- Employees will have the option to Approve or Deny their schedule. 
- Your employees will have a color that corresponds to a status.Click on the Crew/Asset View to show all employees.White - No schedule sent or a change was madeYellow - Pending approvalRed - Denied or ConflictGreen - Confirm

data.title: How Do I Enter An Inventory Budget for Job Costing
data.description: This article will walk you through how to enter a project's estimated inventory budget for Job Costing.
data.body:
It's easy to enter your estimated inventory budget on your projects and this article will walk you through the steps on how to do it! 

# Requirements
 NOTE: In order to enter estimated inventory costs on a project you need to have access to the project, as well as Job Costing permissions. If you do not see the Job Costing Widget on your Project's Dashboard, please contact your Company's FieldFlō Guru and request Job Costing access. 

# Information
 You might be wondering "what is Job Costing?" Job Costing is a module in FieldFlō where you can track your project costs and compare them to your estimate or budget. You can compare your Project's Estimated Costs vs. Actual Costs for Labor, Materials, Equipment, Waste, etc. 

# Here are the steps to entering estimated Inventory costs:

- Navigate to your project. 
- Click theView Detailshyperlink next to Job Costing on the Dashboard. 
- Scroll down toInventory Estimatessection. 
- Enter Budgets forConsumables, Materials, Tools, Equipment, Heavy Equipment, Respirators, and Rentals. 
- Scroll down to bottom and clickSAVE. 
- Back on Project Dashboard, clickJob Costing. 
- View Inventory Estimates vs Actuals. Actual inventory costs are automatically populated in the Job Costing module using data from the "Warehouse Request" forms and inventory Quick Transfers. This helps ensure that your cost tracking remains accurate and up-to-date.

data.title: How Do I Add Per Diem To A Project
data.description: This article will teach you how to set up and approve your hourly or daily Per Diem on your projects.
data.body:
FieldFlō allows you to auto apply your daily or hourly per diems on your job with just a few clicks as well as run reports for approvals. This article will walk you through what you need to do. 

# Requirements
 Note: To update project details you must have the role to "Edit/Delete Projects". 

 Note: To pull the Per Diem Report, you must have "Can Run All Admin Reports". 

- Click onProjectson the left side menu. 
- Filterto find the correct project. 
- Click onProject Details. 
- Click onPer Diem, fill out the required information and clickSave.Auto Apply to Timesheet means that everyone added to the timesheet will receive that amount. 
- To pull the Per Diem Report, clickAdminthenReporting Center. 
- Under General Reports clickPer Dem Report 
- EnterDate Fromand clickGenerate 
- This page is split into 2 sections, Project Summary which gives you the full amount being paid out to employees on a project and Project/Employee Summary which breaks down the employee and project and the daily or hourly amount given. 
- You can click theDaily Rateamount, to update individual amounts to certain people on specific projects 
- UpdatePer Diemto correct amount and clickSubmit. 
- Once all amounts are confirmed, you can approve per diem. 
- You can download CSV or PDF for your records.

data.title: How Do I Close or Put On Hold Multiple Projects?
data.description: This article will allow you to update a large number of projects to Closed or Put On Hold within your system.
data.body:
Being able to update multiple projects to a Closed or On Hold Status has never been easier. You can update that with just a few simple steps to help clean up your projects list and this article will walk you through how to do it. 

# Requirement
 Note : In order to mass update projects you must have the Employee Roles to both Edit/Delete Project AND Close Project. 

# Here are the steps to close or put on hold multiple projects

- ClickProjectson the left hand menu. 
- At the bottom of the Projects page, change the view from 10 to 100 Items. 
- Scroll through the list of Open Projects and select theRadioButtonsbeside the jobs you need to put on hold or close. 
- Once selected, click on theThree Dotsand select the correct status you need the projects changed to. 
- ClickYesto confirm you want to change the status. 
- ClickOkon the notification for the number of projects that have been adjusted.

data.title: How Do I Inactivate/Activate Multiple Employee's?
data.description: This article will allow you to update a large group of employee's to active or inactive status within your system.
data.body:
In only a few clicks you can now activate or inactive multiple employees from your portal! 

# Requirements
 Note : You will need the Employee Role to Edit Employee in order to mass update employee status 

- Click onEmployeeson the left-hand menu. 
- To filter an employee's status, update theStatusdropdown to your need. 
- Once you have filtered by the correct status, you can check the radio button next to each name individually, or, you can select the radio button at the top to select all employee's available. 
- After selecting the employee's you want to inactivate/activate, select thethree dotson the right-hand side and selectActivateorDeactivatedepending on your need. 
- SelectYesto confirm the inactivation/activation of your employees. 
- SelectOKto clear the notification of the number of now active/inactive employees.

data.title: How Do I Auto-Populate Names On The Containment Log
data.description: This article will walk you through how to auto-populate employee names on the Containment Log. Names are transferred from the Timesheet.
data.body:
It's easy to have Employee Names auto-populate on the Containment Log. This article will walk you though the steps to have employee names automatically from the Timesheet. 

# Requirements
 Note: You must open a Timesheet and enter employee names. The Timesheet clock does not need to be started first. 

# Information
 Names transferred from Timesheet will be highlighted in Pink. Pink will go away when log is Saved. 

 Click button below for instructions on how to fill out a Containment Log. 
 How to Complete a Containment Log 

# Here are the steps to automatically transfer Employee Names from the Timesheet to the Containment Log:

- Navigate to yourProject. 
- SelectStart Dayto add a Timesheet to Active Forms. 
- Click onTimesheetto Open it. 
- Add Employee's toTimesheet. 
- Click3 dotsat the top right of your screen and select Back toProject. 
- OpenContainment Log. 
- SelectSAVE.

data.title: How Do I Complete A Containment Log
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps to completing FieldFlō's Containment Log.
data.body:
Completing FieldFlō's Containment log is very easy and article will walk you through the steps on how to do it! 

# Requirements
 Note: To complete a FieldFlō's Containment Log you need the Roles/Permissions to Add/Edit Forms. 

# Information
 FieldFlō's Containment Log can be digitally signed or PIN verified. 

 If your Company has set the Containment Log as a Mandatory Form, it will automatically show on your project when you click the Start Day button. 

 Tip: You can learn how to auto populate employee names on your containment log by clicking this button: 
 Auto-populate Employee Names on Containment Log Tip: The Same as Previous Feature is available on the Containment Log Form. 

- Select the3 dotsat the top right of your screen to apply information from the previous Containment Log. 

# Here are the steps to complete a Containment Log

- Navigate to yourProject. 
- Select theButton. 
- Select bubble forContainment Logand clickSave. 
- Click on theContainment Logform. 
- Fill-in the blanks.Label- Used to differentiate between other Cont. Logs in Closed FormsWork Area -Enter area where Containment is locatedSupervisor-Select Supervisor Name and Enter PINNotes- Free Text Field for any information pertaining to Cont. LogImages- Attach/Upload Photos+Add Row- Adds rows for Employee Name entry 
- Log Containment Entry Information: Employee Name, Resp. Type, Task, In/Out Times. 
- Select bubble next toNameand thenSMS phone iconto deploy verification text. 
- SelectCustomaboveNamefield to enter non-employee entrant details and verification signature. 
- You can also get Hand Signatures from Employees by changing thePINfield to aSignatureField. 
- Click+Add Rowto add additional entrants. ClickSaveto lock-in information and return to the Project. 
- Close Containment Log by either clickingEnd Dayor theClose Formicon.

data.title: How Do I Run A Job Costing Report
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to run a Job Costing report.
data.body:
Running a Job Cost report in FieldFlō is very easy. This article will walk you through the steps to running a report to view Job Costing Details in Excel format. With this report you can quickly compare your Estimated Costs vs Actual Costs for one or multiple projects at a time. 

# Requirements
 The Job Costing Report is in the Reporting Center. To access the reporting center you must have the Role/Permission to Run all Admin Reports. 

# Information
 Click the following button to view the steps on how to export a more detailed Job Costing report per Project: 
 How Do I Export Job Costing Estimates 

# Here are the steps to running a Job Costing Report:

- ClickAdminon your Left Main Menu. 
- The admin drop down will appear, scroll down and selectReporting Center. 
- SelectJob Costing Report. 
- Select/Unselect radio buttons forProject TypeandProjectsto run the report for. 
- On the top right, clickRun Report.

data.title: How Do I Create And Send Messages
data.description: This article will walk you through all the steps to create and send messages from the Messaging Module.
data.body:
It is easy to create and send messages to your workforce from the FieldFlō messaging module. This article will walk you though the steps for creating and sending messages. 

# Requirements
 Note: To use the Messaging Module you must have the Role/Permissions to "Create Messages". 

# Information
 Messages can be deployed via Text message to all Employees with phone numbers in your FieldFlō portals. 

 Messages can also be deployed to User's Dashboards. Anyone with login access will be able to see these messages on their Main Dashboard. 

 Messages can be filtered by Type: Safety or Company . 
 Safety - messages that are related to Safety topics or Memos. 
 Company - any message that is not Safety related. 

 Tip : After message is Saved , Select View Message to view an example of your message. 

 Tip: Deploying messages to the Dashboard is great for Deadline reminders! 

# Here are the steps to creating and sending messages:

- ClickMessageson your Left Main Menu. 
- Use Search and Type Fields to filter previously created Messages. 
- Click+Add Message. 
- Enter messageSubjectand choose aType. 
- ClickNEXTand selectMessage Contenttype: Text Block, Embed Video, Document, Link, Image, Title Block. 
- Add additionalMessage ContentBlocks as needed. 
- ClickNEXT. 
- Select Deployment Types:SMSand/orDashboardSMS- Sends text message to EmployeesDashboard- Message is displayed on FieldFlo Dashboard for Users with Login access to see. 
- ClickEnroll Employee. 
- UseFiltersand select Employee NameBubbles. 
- ClickADDto add Employee Names to deployment list. 
- SelectEmployee Name Radio Buttonsand clickDeployto send message. 
- Select the3 little dotson your message to view, make edits, deploy to additional employees. 
- ClickEnroll/Enrolledto view read receipts. 
- Return to Dashboard and scroll down to Message block to view messages deployed to Dashboard.

data.title: How Do I Default Labor Hours Widget to Mandays
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to change the default for the Labor Hours Widget to Mandays.
data.body:
It is very easy to change your Company Settings to default the Labor Hours Widget to Mandays. 

# Requirements
 Note: You must have Super Admin Access to change this setting. 

# Information
 Changing this setting will effect all projects on your FieldFlo portal. 

 Click the following button to learn how to toggle between Mandays and Labor Hours per Project: 
 Change Labor Hours to Mandays on Project's Dashboard 

# Here are the steps to defaulting all Project's Labor Hour Widgets to Mandays:

- ClickCompanyon your Left Main Menu. 
- Scroll to the bottom of Company Details and select the bubble for "Default to Mandays on Project Dashboard." 
- Click Save to apply the change.

data.title: How Do I Change The Labor Hours Widget to Mandays
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to toggle between Labor Hours and Mandays on the Project's Dashboard.
data.body:
It is easy to change a project's Labor Hours Widget to display Mandays. The following article will walk you through the steps to view a project's Labors in Mandays instead. 

# Requirements
 NOTE : You must have the Employee Role/Permission to "View Labor Hours Dashboard" to view the Labor Hours/Manday Widget. 

# Information
 Mandays are calculated by dividing Labor Hours by 8. 
 8 Labor Hours = 1 Manday 

 Click the following button to view steps on how to default the Labor Hours Widget to Mandays. 
 Default Labor Widget to Mandays Click the following button to learn how to enter a Labor Hour/Manday Budget. 
 How to Enter Labor Hour Budget 

# The following are the steps to change the Labor Hours Widget to Mandays:

- Navigate to a Project. 
- Click on theLabor Hours Widget. 
- SelectManday Bubble. 
- View Mandays Bid, Actual, and Remaining. 
- Click anywhere inMandays Widgetto return to Project's Dashboard.

data.title: How Do I Upload Document To Projects
data.description: This article explains how to upload documents to projects.
data.body:
It is easy to upload documents to projects within FieldFlo and this article will walk you through how to do it. 

# Requirements
 Note: If you are trying to upload documents to FieldFlo Projects, you must have access to "Add Docs". If you do not have this access, you will have to reach out to your companies Super Admin for them to provide this access. 

# Information
 You may be asking yourself what kind of documents you want to upload into FieldFlo. A couple of examples might be email communications, plans, photos etc. 

 Any of these items can be easily added by following the directions in this article. 

 Here are the steps to adding Documents to Projects in FieldFlo 

- On the left hand side of your screen, click on theProjectsModule. 
- Find the project that you are looking for and click on the "Project". 
- On the top right of the project, click thethree little dotsthen clickDocuments. 
- Once you are on the Document Management page of the project, you can either create folders by clicking+Add Folderor you can add the files by clicking+Add Files. 
- If you click+Add Folders, the Add Folder pop out will appear. Enter theFolder Nameand set the permissions for who should have access to the Folder. Then clickSave. 
- If you click+Add Files,the Add File pop out will appear and you can clickChoose Fileand find the locate the files, photos etc., that you would like to add. You can also set the permissions for who should have access to these files here. Once done clickSave.

data.title: How Do I Add Multiple Forms to a Project
data.description: This article will teach you how to enable multiple forms onto a specific project.
data.body:
In only a few clicks you will be able to add Multiples of either the Daily Timesheet and/or the PSI/JHA same form to your Project allowing labels for different Supervisors or Phases. 

# Requirement
 Note: You must have the role to Edit/Delete Projects to adjust this project setting. 

# Information
 Enabling multiple forms on a project will allow you to name each form by using the label. 

# Here Are the Steps to Setting Up Multiple Forms on a Project

- ClickProjectson the left side of your screen. 
- Filter to find the needed project and click on theProject. 
- Click theThree Dotsand selectDetails. 
- Click onSettingsunder Project Details and selectYesin the dropdown underAllow Multiple Timesheetsand/orAllow Multiple PSI/JHA. 
- ClickSave.

data.title: How Do I Enter Contract Values on Projects
data.description: This article will walk you through how to enter a project's contract value on FieldFlō.
data.body:
Entering a project's contract value is very easy and this article will walk you through the steps on how to do it! 

# Requirements
 NOTE: In order to enter contract values on a project you need to have access to the project, permissions to view contract values, and access to the Job Costing module. If you do not see the Job Costing Widget on your Project's Dashboard, please contact your Company's FieldFlō Guru and request Job Costing access. 

# Information
 You might be wondering what is Job Costing. Job Costing is a module in FieldFlō where you can track your project costs and compare them to your estimate or budget. You can compare your Project's Estimated Costs vs. Actual Costs for Labor, Materials, Equipment, Waste, etc. 

# Here are the steps to entering Contract Values:

- Navigate to your project. 
- Click theView Detailshyperlink next to Job Costing on the Dashboard. 
- Click the field underContract Valueto enter dollar figure. 
- Enter the project's contract value. 
- Scroll to bottom of Job Costing and ClickSave. 
- On Project's Dashboard, to see detailed view of your Contract Value vs Current Project Cost, ClickJob Costingwidget.

data.title: How Do I Move Forms To a Different Project
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to move forms from one project to another.
data.body:
It is very easy to move a Project's Form(s) to a different project. The following article will walk you through how to move one or multiple forms to a different project at the same time. 

# Requirements
 NOTE: You must have the Employee Role/Permission to "Edit/Delete Closed Forms." 

 Forms can only be moved after they have been Closed. 

 Access to both the project with the forms that are to be moved and the project to which the forms are being moved is required. 

# Here are the steps to move completed forms to a different project:

- On your left main menu, clickProjects. 
- Search for your Project in theQuick Search Field. 
- Click on theProject. 
- From the Project Dashboard ClickClosed Forms. 
- Select theBubblesnext to the Form names that you would like to move to a different project. 
- Select the redMove Formsbutton on the right side of your screen. 
- Find the Project Name that you want to move the forms to. 
- SelectMOVE FORMS. 
- A notification window will be displayed confirming that your forms were successfully moved.

data.title: How Do I Add a Form I Built to My Project?
data.description: This article will show you how to add your custom built form to your projects.
data.body:
In order to see the newly built form you just created, you will need to follow the below steps to make them available on your projects. 

# Information
 If you would like to learn how to create custom forms for your company, you can email us at support@fieldflo.com to set up a training with your Customer Success Manager. 

 Here is a quick video that shows you how to make a form you built available to choose from on your Projects:

data.title: How Do I Set Up Mandatory (Global) Forms on Projects
data.description: This article explains how you set up Global Form Settings that are required on a project at the start of every shift.
data.body:
Automatically setting up which forms will populate on all of your projects for your Supervisors to complete has never been easier. 

# Requirements
 NOTE: In order to access Global Form Settings, you must have access as a Super Admin for your company. 

# Information
 Global Form Settings will let you choose the mandatory forms and other forms that you would like to have available on all projects. With this option you won’t have to set up form settings every time a project is created. In the event that you would like a project to have different or additional forms from the ones selected on the Global Form Setting, you can do that using Project Level Form Settings. To set Project Level Form Settings, click here . FieldFlo provides two levels of form accessibility settings: 
 Information Global Form Settings will let you choose the mandatory forms and other forms that you would like to have available on all projects. With this option you won’t have to set up form settings every time a project is created. In the event that you would like a project to have different or additional forms from the ones selected on the Global Form Setting, you can do that using Project Level Form Settings. To set Project Level Form Settings, click here . FieldFlo provides two levels of form accessibility settings: 

- Global Form Settings:These settings apply to all projects by default, but individual forms can be excluded from specific projects. 
- Project-Level Form Settings:Forms can be explicitly included or excluded at the project level for finer control. 

# Here are the steps to set up Global Forms

- On the left hand side of your screen clickCompany. 
- Under Company Detail, scroll down to the Other section, clicktheradio buttonto enable Default to Global Form Settings on New Projects then clickSave. 
- After saving your settings, click onProjects. 
- Once in the project section you will click on theThree Dots (Admin Menu)and then click onGlobal Forms Setting. 
- Once the window opens, click the radio button under the Mandatory Column of the form you want to require. 
- Once you set your Mandatory Forms, you can scroll to the bottom andSave.# FAQs about Global and Project-Level Form SettingsWhat happens if I uncheck a form in Global Form Settings?If a form is deselected in Global Form Settings, it will no longer be accessible in projects relying solely on global defaults. However, the form will still be available in any project where it has been explicitly included via Project Level Form Settings.How does Global Form Settings work with Project-Level Form Settings?If all projects, except one target project, adhere to Global Form Settings, unselecting a form in the global settings will make it unavailable to all those projects. However, it will remain accessible in the target project if Project Level Form Settings are configured to include it. 7. If you wish to restrict a form to only one target project, locate the form in the Global Forms Setting and unselect the associated bubble (e.g., for the "Daily Field Report" form). 8. Scroll down and clickSaveto apply these restrictions. These changes ensure the form is excluded from other projects unless specified using Project Level Form Settings.

data.title: How Do I Set Up Project Level Form Settings
data.description: This article will teach how to set up Project Level Forms allowing you to have different or additional forms from the standard settings.
data.body:
FieldFlo makes it simple to manage and customize forms to suit your project's needs. This article will guide you specifically on setting up Project Level Form Settings while also giving you an overview of FieldFlo's form management capabilities. 

# Requirements
 Note: In order to access Project Level Form Settings, you must have Edit/Delete Projects list as a role. 

# Information
 Project Level Form Setting will let you customize the forms that you would like to have available on a specific project. With this option you can pick and choose the needed forms for a project. In the event that you would like to set up the same mandatory forms on all projects, you can do so with Global Form Setting. To set Global Form Settings, click here . 
 Additionally, FieldFlo provides two distinct levels of form settings to meet diverse user needs: Global Form Settings for overarching configurations across projects and Project-Level Form Settings for fine-tuned control within individual projects. 

# Here are the steps to set up Project Level Form Settings

- On your company dashboard left menu section you will findProjectsand click on it. 
- Filter to find the project needed and click Project that you want to add the Project Level Form Settings to. 
- Once you are inside the project, click onProject Details. 
- Once inside the Project Menu, you will need to click onSettings. 
- Once you are inside the settings section, you will want to change the Form Settings to Project Level Form Settings. Scroll down until you seeForm Settingsand in the dropdown selectProject Level Form Settings. 
- Once completed, clickSave 

# Additional Information About Form Management
 FieldFlo also offers pre-created form templates that can simplify your workflow. Here are some important points to consider: 

 If you require a more tailored form, you have the option to create a new one rather than modifying an existing template. This approach preserves the standards set by the pre-created templates while allowing flexibility.

data.title: How Do I Give My Employee Login Access to FieldFlo?

data.title: How Do I Add Permits / Custom Notifications To A Project?

In only a few clicks you will be able to add Permits and Notifications to your Project. This allows you to be reminded of expiring permits, or this can be curated to anything you need to be notified about. This article will walk you through exactly how to do this!

data.title: How Do I Reset My Own PIN
data.description: This article walks you through how to reset your own PIN
data.body:
It is easy to reset your own PIN and this article will walk you through exactly how to do it. 

# Requirements
 NOTE: In order to change your Employee PIN, you must be able to log into FieldFlō. If you do not have access to log into FieldFlō, you will need to contact your company's FieldFlō guru. 

# Information
 You might be wondering, " What is a PIN? " A PIN is an employees Personal Identification Number. This number is what an employee will use as their Legal Signature when verifying: 

- Daily Timesheets 
- PSI / JHA / SPA 
- Inspection Forms 
- etc. You may be wondering, " Who needs a PIN? " All employees need a PIN. 

 Or maybe you are asking, " How do I know what the PIN should be? " FieldFlo recommends that you use the last 4 digits for an employees Social Security. The reason(s) we recommend this are: 

- It is easier for Admins to set these up because they probably have access to this already 
- It is easier for an employee to remember 
- It is a legally bound number to the employee 
- It is less likely that an employee will be willing to share this confidential number with their fellow employees 

# Here are the steps to resetting your own PIN:

- Click on yourimageorblue circlein the bottom left corner and this will bring up yourprofile. 
- Scroll down and click on "Edit Pin" at the bottom right of your screen. 
- Enter yourPINand clickSave.

data.title: What Do I Do If An Employee Is Not Receiving Text Messages
data.description: This article will cover exactly what to do to ensure that employees are receiving text messages.
data.body:
If an employee is not receiving text message, there are several things that you can try. This article will walk you through exactly what to do. 

 NOTE: If the employee is receiving text messages but is not able to check-in on their device, the employee may have location services turned off. Here are a few options for getting this turned on based on the operating system of the device: 

- Android Devices:https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/3467281?hl=en 
- Apple Devices:https://support.apple.com/en-us/102647 NOTE: If sms messages fail 10 times in a row, then opt out will be auto selected. If selected, sms messages will no longer be sent to this phone number. If Opt Out is un-selected, then sms messages will resume sending again. Keep in mind, if 10 failed delivers in a row happen again, it will auto mark as Opt Out. If this happens the employee must contact his mobile carrier. 

# Here are the steps to take if any employee is not receiving text messages:

- The first thing you should do is checkFieldFloto see if theEmployeehas the "SMS Opt Out" radio button checked on theirEmployeeprofile.On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click onEmployees.Find theEmployeethat is having the issue and click on theEmployee.Scroll down until you see "SMS Opt Out". If this is checked, uncheck it. 
- The next thing you should do is check to see if theEmployeehas blocked theFieldFlonumber on their phone. TheFieldFlophone number is 833.341.3939. If the number has been blocked, you will need to have theEmployeeunblock it. 
- The next thing you should do is have theEmployeesave theFieldFlonumber to their contact list. This will help theEmployeeavoid marking the number as "junk". 
- If theEmployeeis still not receiving text messages, you should have the employee text the word "Unstop" to theFieldFlonumber. 
- If the above options have not worked, theEmployeewill need to contact their cell phone service provider and ask them to unblock messages coming from theFieldFlonumber.

data.title: How Do I Show or Hide The Photo Gallery

FieldFlo allows you to show or hide your company's Photo Gallery and this article walks you through exactly how to do this.

data.title: How Do I Create An Inspection Form
data.description: This article walks you through creating your own Inspection Form.
data.body:
FieldFlo allows you to create your own custom inspection form, and this article will walk you through exactly what to do. 

# Here are the steps to creating an Inspection Form

- On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, clickAdmin. 
- Several items will appear underAdmin. Scroll down and clickPortal Admins. 
- Once on thePortal Adminspage, scroll down to theSafetysection and clickINSPECTION MGMT. 
- On the top right of theInspection MGMTpage, click+ Add Inspection. 
- TheAdd Inspection Typepop out will appear and there are a few mandatory fields that are visibly marked with a red *. The mandatory fields are:Name(this should be the description of theInspection Form)Type(the types available areRegular,EquipmentandInventory Item) 
- ClickSave.NOTE: FieldFlorecommends not to click theActiveradio button until you have finished creating theInspection Form. 
- Now that you have finished adding theInspection Type, click inside theNamefield and type in the first few letters of your newly addedInspection Typeand hitEnteron your keyboard. 
- Once you find theInspection Type, click thethree little dotson the right hand side of theInspection Type. 
- TheInspection Type Adminwill dropdown. ClickEdit Section. 
- Now you should be on theInspection Sectionspage. Click+ Add Section. 
- TheAdd InspectionSectionpop out will appear. Click inside theNamefield to name yourInspection Section. 
- Next, you need to add aWeight.NOTE:The total combinedWeightof all the sections your create must total to 100. For example, if you have 4 sections, each section should have aWeightof 25. 
- ClickSave. 
- Repeat these steps for all theSectionsyou have. 
- Once you have finished adding all of yourSections, on the right hand side of eachSection, you will seethree little dots. Click thethree little dots. 
- TheAdmindropdown will appear. ClickEdit Questions. 
- Now you are on theInspection Section Questionspage. Click+ Add Questions. 
- TheQuestionfield is mandatory and is visibly marked by a red *. Click inside theQuestionfield and type in theQuestionyou want to ask. 
- ClickSave. 
- Repeat these steps for all theQuestionsyou have. 
- Once you have finished adding all of yourInspection SectionsandInspection Questions, go back to theInspection MGMTpage, find your newly createdInspectionand click on theInspection. 
- TheEdit Inspectionpop out will appear. Click theActiveradio button and clickSave.

data.title: How Do I Add / Edit A Certification Category
data.description: This article walks you through adding and editing Certification Categories.
data.body:
It is very easy to add or edit Certification Categories and this article will walk you through exactly how to do it! 

# Here are the steps to adding a Certification Category

- On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click onCertification. 
- TheCertificationmodule will expand. Click onCertificates. 
- You will be taken to theCertificatespage. On the top right of theCertificatespage, click thethree little dots. 
- The admin dropdown will appear. ClickCert Names. 
- Click the+ Add Cert Namebutton. 
- Enter theCert Namein theCert Namefield and clickSave. 

# Here are the steps to editing a Certification Category

- On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click onCertification. 
- TheCertificationmodule will expand. Click onCertificates. 
- You will be taken to theCertificatespage. On the top right of theCertificatespage, click thethree little dots. 
- TheAdmindropdown will appear. ClickCert Names. 
- Find theCertification Namethat you want to change by searching the name in the search bar or scroll to find theCertificate. Click on thethree little dotson the right hand side of theCertification Namethat you want to edit. 
- TheCertification Nameadmin dropdown will appear. ClickEdit. 
- Edit theCert Nameand clickSave.

data.title: How To Setup The FieldFlo Offline Application
data.description: This article will walk you through setting up the FieldFlo Offline Application.
data.body:
It is very easy to setup the FieldFlo offline app, and this article walks you through exactly what to do. 

# Information
 NOTE: The FieldFlo offline application can be dowloaded from either the: 
 Android App Store Apple App Store NOTE: This allows Supervisors / Foreman / Superintendents to fill out paperwork offline and will upload the data to your Company's FieldFlo portal once the device has internet service. 

# Here are the steps to setting up the FieldFlo Offline Application

- After you have downloaded theFieldFlooffline application to your device, you will be asked for your company'sQR Code. 
- On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, clickCompanymodule. 
- Once on theCompany Detailspage, scroll down and scan theSet Data for Mobile AppQR Code.Note- The first time the app is used it will need to download a lot of data, so it is best to do this when your device is on WiFi. It can take several minutes to download this data if there is a lot of data to download.

data.title: How Do I Setup Email Notifications For Closed Forms
data.description: This article walks through setting up email notifications for Closed Forms.
data.body:
Email Notifications for Closed Forms can be very useful and this article will walk you through how to receive these! 

# Here are the steps to setup email notifications for Closed Forms

- On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click theProjectsmodule. 
- On the top right of theProjectmodule, click thethree little dots. 
- TheAdminmenu will dropdown. Click onGlobal Forms Settings. 
- TheGlobal Forms Settingspop out will appear and next to each of the forms, you will see a radio button forClosed Form Settings. Click theClosed Form Settingsradio button. 
- Just to the right of theClosed Form Settingsradio button you will see a gear, click theGearto setupEmail Notificationsfor the form. 
- AnotherClosed Form Settingspop out will appear, follow the steps given.Note:Step 1- This step is selecting the format of theEmail Notificationthat is sent, you can editEmail Templatesin yourAdminsection inFieldFlo.Step 2- This step is selecting who will receive theEmail Notification,you can chose byEmail groups,Key Project Personnel, and yourAdmins. You can editEmail groupsunder yourAdminsection inFieldFlo, also can editKey Project PersonnelandAdminaccess under theEmployeesection.View Restrictions- This sets up who can view theseClosed Forms. 
- Scroll down and clickSave. 
- Once you have clicked save, you will be taken back to theGlobal Forms Settingspop out. Repeat step 5 and step 6 for each of the forms you want to receiveEmail Notificationsfor. 
- After you are done with the setup for all of your forms, scroll to the bottom of the Global Forms Setting pop out and clickSave.

data.title: How Do I Add Union Skill Levels

data.title: How Do I Add A Position Group
data.description: This article will walk you through how to add a Position Group.
data.body:
Position Groups are convenient because they allow you to group positions together. You can then choose which groups are available on each project, which will narrow down the list of positions you have to choose from. It is very easy to add a Position Group in FieldFlo and this article covers exactly what you need to do! 

# Required
 In order to add Position Groups, you must have the Edit Employee role enabled. 

# Here are the steps to add a Position Group:

- On the left side, in the main menu click theEmployeemodule. 
- On the top right of the screen click theThree Little Dots. 
- The Employee Admin menu will appear. ClickPositions. 
- Click on the bluePositions Groupsbutton. 
- You will be taken to the Positions Groups page. Click+ Add Groups 
- The Add Groups pop out will appear. Enter theGroup Namein the Group Name field. 
- Click theAdd Positiondropdown and select all of the Positions you want to add to the Position Group. 
- Once you have selected all of the positions you want added to the Position Group, click the blueSavebutton.

data.title: How Do I Add A Position

data.title: How Do I Setup Notifications?
data.description: This article explains how to setup notifications from FieldFlo,
data.body:
FieldFlo can send you notifications via email, and this article explains exactly where to go and how to start receiving these. 

# Information

- TheDaily Notificationssection send out emails from FieldFlo twice a day. Once at 7:05am and once at 7:05pm. 
- TheInstant Notificationssection send out instant emails from FieldFlo. 

# Here are the steps to setting up notifications

- On your company dashboard on the top right side of the screen find theGearicon and click on theGearicon. 
- You will be taken to theSettingspage. Click theRadiobutton next to each item that you want to receive email notifications from FieldFlo on. 
- Once you have chosen your notifications click on the blueSavebutton and you will start receiving email notifications from FieldFlo.

data.title: How Do I Create A Closeout Report
data.description: This article will walk you through creating a Close Out Document.
data.body:
FieldFlo has made it very easy for you to create Closeout Report, and this article will walk you through exactly what to do. 

# Here are the steps to creating a Closeout Report

- One the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click theProjectsmodule. 
- You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Once you have found the project click on theProject. 
- If the Project is complete, you have uploaded any needed Project documents, you are ready to close the project and you are ready to generate a Closeout Report, click theThree Little Dotson the top right of your screen. 
- The Project Admin menu will appear. ClickClose Project. 
- ThePlease Confirm?popup will appear. Click theYes & Create Closeout Reportbutton. 
- You will be taken to theGenerate Closeout Report - Step 1page. Click theRadio Buttonnext to each portion that you want to include in you Closeout Report.Examples: Daily Forms, Permits, Certifications, any documents that you have uploaded in the document vault of a project, etc.Note- You may want to upload a photo of you choosing to change the cover page, but note that the picture must be a JPG and must fit the following specifications:1500px x 750px - max 6MB. 
- Now that you have selected everything that you want to include, click the blueGO TO NEXT STEPbutton. 
- You will be taken to theGenerate Closeout Report - Step 2page. Review yourCOVER PAGE & TABLE OF CONTENTS. 
- If everything looks good, enter yourEmail Addressin the Enter Email Addresses field. 
- Click on the blueSubmitbutton and FieldFlo will send you an email letting you know that the closeout document is ready for download. 
- After a few minutes check your email. Once you receive the email from FieldFlo, click on theemail linkthat will take you back to the project in FieldFlo. 
- Click theThree Little Dotson the top right of your screen, and click onCloseout Report. 
- TheCLOSEOUT REPORT ALREADY EXISTSpopup will appear. Click theDownload Currentbutton. 
- After your download finished you will be able to save it to your device and send it to your clients.

data.title: How Do I Add Cost Types To The Expense Form Dropdown?

Adding Cost Types allows you to complete an Expense Form with specific types of company costs. - Scroll down to theExpensesection, selectCost Types. 
- From here, you can see all of the existing cost type options, and if you want to add new cost types click the blue+ Add Cost Typebutton. 
- TheAdd Cost Typepop out will appear.Note- You will need to enter the required fields :a.Codeb.Name 
- ClickSave.Now your new cost type(s) will be options while completing the Expense Form:

data.title: How Do I Send Closed Forms?
data.description: This article covers how to send closed forms.
data.body:
FieldFlo makes it easy to send closed forms, and this article will walk you through what to do! 

# Here are the steps to send open forms

- One the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click theProjectsmodule. 
- You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Once you have found the project click on theProject. 
- To see yourClosed Forms, click theClosed Formstab. 
- You can filter for specific forms by theTypedropdown, byLabelor theDatedropdown. 
- Select theRadioButtonnext to each of the forms that you want to send or you can click theRadio Buttonon the left side above the forms to select all of them. 
- After you have selected all the closed forms that you want to send, click the blueSend Formbutton. 
- The Send Forms menu will appear and you can select anEmail Groupin the Email Group dropdown, or you can add aCustom Emailin theAdd EmailField and click the+button to add more emails individually.

data.title: How Do I Send Open Forms?
data.description: This article covers how to send open forms.
data.body:
FieldFlo makes it easy to send open forms, and this article will walk you through what to do! 

# Here are the steps to send open forms

- One the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click theProjectsmodule. 
- You can scroll down to find yourProject. Or filter your options byProject Name,Project NumberorClient Name.If you would like more filtering options, click the blue+ Filterbutton and select any of the additional filters you may want. 
- Once you have found the project click on theProject. 
- If you want to send an individual open form click theEnvelopeicon on the right side of the open form 
- The Send Forms menu will appear and you can select anEmail Groupin theEmail Groupdropdown, or you can add aCustom Emailin the Add Email Field and click the+button. 
- You will then select aTemplatein the Template dropdown. 
- ClickSend. 
- If you want to send multiple open forms, click theRadio Buttonon the left hand side next to every open form you want to send. 
- Once you have selected the open forms you want to send, click the three little dots on the right side just above all the open forms. 
- ClickSend Forms. 
- The Send Forms menu will appear and you can select anEmail Groupin the Email Group dropdown, or you can add aCustom Emailin the Add Email Field and click the+button. 
- You will then select aTemplatein the Template dropdown. 
- ClickSend.

data.title: Phone Version - How Do I Fill Out An Expense Form?
data.description: This article covers how to fill out an expense form.
data.body:
It is easy to fill out an expense form and this article will walk you through exactly what to do! 

# Here are the steps to fill out an Expense Form

- After you log in you will see the FieldFloDashboard. Click the three lines on the top left to expand your menu. 
- One the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click theProjectsmodule. 
- You can scroll down to find your project or click on the blue+ Filterbutton to search byProject Name,Project Numberor any of the other fields you would like to search by. 
- Once you found your project, click anywhere on the project to open up the details. 
- On the bottom of your screen, click the blue+button to add your form. 
- Find theExpense Formand selectRadio Buttonjust to the left of the form. 
- Scroll to the bottom and clickSave. 
- Click on theExpense Form. 
- The Date field is not editable and is set as the date you open the form. 
- Depending on what your company requires, enter the appropriate information in theSS (Social Security Number) / ID (Employee ID). 
- In the Employee dropdown select theEmployeethat this form needs to be submitted. 
- Click+ Add Row. (Click the + Add Row as many times as needed for every expense that needs to be submitted) 
- After adding all the rows that you need, several field will appear. Fill out all the information in each of the fields that is needed:Purchase DateProject TypeCost TypeCostReimbursablePurchase FromReceipt #Description 
- Add a picture of the receipt by clickingChoose File. 
- After all the rows have been filled out, clickSave all. Now yourExpenseform is complete

data.title: Phone Version - How Do I Open Daily Forms?
data.description: This article walks Supervisors / Foreman / Superintendents through opening Mandatory Daily Forms
data.body:
It is easy in FieldFlo for Supervisors / Foreman / Superintendents to open daily forms. This article will walk Supervisors / Foreman / Superintendents through doing it! 

# Here are the steps to filling out Daily Forms

- After you log in you will see the FieldFloDashboard. Click on the three lines on the top left to expand the menu. 
- Click on theProjectsmodule. 
- To find your project you may scroll down and look for it or you may press the+ Filterbutton and enter theProject Name,Project Numberor any other field you would like to search by. 
- Once you find your project, click on the name to go into the project and see the project information. 
- Click on the blueStart Daybutton to open up the mandatory forms you must complete set by your company for this project. 
- If you need additional forms you may click the blue+a window will open. You will have the ability to select and add any additional forms you may need for this project.Note: When adding additional forms, select the bubble to the left of the form name. When you have all your forms you need selected, scroll down and hit the blueSavebutton. 
- Any forms that appear red have required fields that are incomplete.Note: These forms will turn white when fully completed, before you stop your project and clickEnd Day, all of these mandatory forms should not be red.

data.title: Phone Version - How Do I Fill Out A Waste Load Out Form
data.description: This article explains how to fill out a Waste Load Out Form
data.body:
It is easy to fill out a Waste Load Out Form in FieldFlo and this article will explain how to do it! 

# Here are the steps to filling out a Waste Load Out Form

- One the left hand side of your screen click the threes lines on the top. 
- Click theProjectsmodule. 
- Find the project you need to fill out a Waste Load Out Form on by clicking on thex Filterbutton. This will drop down your filter options. 
- Search for your project byProject Nameor byProject Number. 
- Once you have found the project click on theProject. 
- On the bottom of your screen, click the blue+button. 
- Find theWaste Load Out Formand select theRadio Buttonjust to the left of the form. 
- Scroll to the bottom and clickSave. 
- Click on theWaste Load Out Form. 
- Select the date in theCreation Datedropdown. 
- Select the Supervisor in theSupervisordropdown. 
- Click the+ New Loadbutton. This will add Load 1 to your form. 
- Under each of the loads you have added, there will be an information section. Enter in as much information as you can about each load in each of the provided fields. 
- You can add a picture of the manifest by clicking on theChoose Filebutton under theImagessection. 
- Click theSave Allbutton. 
- If you have multiple loads, you can click the+ New Loadto add as many loads as you need or you can make a copy of the load you just created and update the necessary information and add new manifest pictures to each copy. 
- To copy a load, go to theCreate Multiple Copies of this loaddropdown and select # of loads you wish to create. 
- Once you have finished creating all of your loads, make sure to click theSave Allbutton.

data.title: How Do I Create An Email Template
data.description: This article covers creating an email template.
data.body:
It is very easy to create an email template in FieldFlo and this article will walk you through exactly what you need to do it. 

# Here are the steps to creating an email template

- On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click theAdmin Module. 
- Underneath the Admin module several options will appear. ClickEmail Templates. 
- You will be taken to the Email Templates page. Click the+ Add Templatesbutton. 
- Fill out the fields that are required. These fields are notated with a red *Note :The required are:From EmailFrom NameSubject 
- (Optional) You can double click any of the options listed in the brackets "{}".Note : All of the options are:{LINKS} - This one must be added to your email if you want forms from FieldFlo to attach{FORM DETAILS}{LOGO}{CLIENT COMPANY}{OUR COMPANY}{DATE}{SUPERVISOR}{MY NAME}{MESSAGE} 
- After filling out all needed fields, clickSave.

data.title: How Do I Deactivate A Client

data.title: How Do I Create A New Client

data.title: How Do I Create Email Groups?
